examples.en: The replacement of old pipes will take three days.
examples.zh: 更换旧管道将需要三天。

examples.en: Battery replacements are available at the front desk.
examples.zh: 前台有电池更换服务。

extraExplanation: “replacement / replacements”在日常英语里很常见，既可以指“替代的人/物”（可数），也可以指“更换这件事”（多为不可数，但在服务或商品类别中也常用复数，如“battery replacements”“screen replacements”表示“更换电池/屏幕的服务或项目”。
词形提示：replacement = replace（替换）+ -ment（名词后缀，表示“行为/结果”）。

summary.en: A replacer is someone or something that takes the place of another; in tech, it can mean a tool that replaces text/values.
summary.zh: replacer 指“替代者/替换物”；在技术语境中也可指用于替换文本或数值的工具。

definition.en: A person or thing that replaces another (one that takes the place of something else).
definition.zh: 替代者；替换物（用来取代另一个人或物的事物）。

examples.en: We need a replacer for the broken part.
examples.zh: 我们需要一个替换掉坏零件的替换件。

examples.en: The company hired a temporary replacer while she was on leave.
examples.zh: 她休假期间，公司雇了一个临时替代人员。

definition.en: In computing, a tool or program function that replaces text or values with something else (often used in “search-and-replace”).
definition.zh: （计算机）替换器；替换工具（把文本或数值替换成其他内容的工具，常见于“查找并替换”）。

examples.en: Use the replacer to change all instances of “color” to “colour.”
examples.zh: 用替换工具把所有的“color”都改成“colour”。

examples.en: This script includes a replacer for sensitive words.
examples.zh: 这个脚本包含一个用于敏感词的替换器。

extraExplanation: “replacer”由动词 replace（替换）+ 后缀 -er 构成，-er 常表示“做某事的人/物”（如 teacher, cleaner）。在日常英语里，更常见的说法是 replacement（替代品/替代物）或 substitute（替代者/替代品）；replacer 在技术语境或需要强调“执行替换动作的东西”时更常见。

summary.en: “Replacers” means substitutes—people, parts, or tools used to replace something else.
summary.zh: “replacers”指“替代者/替代物”，也可指（计算机中的）替换工具/功能。

definition.en: People or things that replace someone or something; substitutes.
definition.zh: 替代者；替代物；代替品。

examples.en: The company hired replacers while the staff were on vacation.
examples.zh: 员工休假期间，公司雇了替代人员。

examples.en: These filters are cheap, so we keep a few replacers in storage.
examples.zh: 这些滤芯很便宜，所以我们会在仓库里备一些替代品。

definition.en: (Computing) Tools or features that automatically change one word, character, or pattern into another (as in “find and replace”).
definition.zh: （计算机）自动把某个词/字符/模式替换成另一个的工具或功能（如“查找并替换”）。

examples.en: Text editors often have powerful replacers for cleaning up repeated typos.
examples.zh: 文本编辑器常有很强的替换功能，用来清理反复出现的拼写错误。

examples.en: Use a replacer to change all tabs into spaces.
examples.zh: 用替换功能把所有制表符（tab）改成空格。

extraExplanation: “replacers”是“replacer”的复数。replacer由 replace（替换）+ -er（做某事的人/物）构成，意思就是“用来替换的那个人/东西”。
在口语里，如果指“替换的人”，更常说 substitute(s) 或 replacement(s)；如果指“替换零件/备件”，常说 replacement part(s) 或 spare(s)。

summary.en: “Replaces” means “takes the place of” or “puts back,” and it is the third-person singular form of “replace.”
summary.zh: “replaces”是“replace”的第三人称单数，表示“取代/替换”或“放回原处/归还”。

definition.en: (3rd person singular of “replace”) to take the place of someone or something; to be used instead of it.
definition.zh: （replace 的第三人称单数）取代；替换；代替（某人或某物的位置/用途）。

examples.en: This new model replaces the old one.
examples.zh: 这款新型号取代了旧型号。

examples.en: AI sometimes replaces repetitive tasks, not entire jobs.
examples.zh: 人工智能有时会替代重复性任务，而不是整个工作。

definition.en: to put something back in its original place or return it after using it.
definition.zh: 放回原处；归还（用过的东西）。

examples.en: She replaces the book on the shelf after reading.
examples.zh: 她读完后把书放回书架。

examples.en: Please replace the lid tightly.
examples.zh: 请把盖子盖回去并拧紧。

extraExplanation: “replace”常见搭配：replace A with B（用B替换A）；也可以说B replaces A（B取代A）。注意不要把两种结构混在一起：不说 *replace B to A。
“replace”强调“取代/顶替的位置”，而“substitute”更强调“作为替代品临时使用”。例如：Water can substitute for milk in this recipe（这道食谱里水可以临时代替牛奶），但说This new phone replaces my old phone（新手机取代旧手机）更自然。

summary.en: “Replacing” means putting something new in place of something else, or taking over someone’s role.
summary.zh: “replacing”指用新的事物替换旧的事物，或接替某人的角色/职位。

definition.en: putting something new in the place of something old, broken, lost, or no longer needed
definition.zh: 用新的东西代替旧的、坏的、丢失的或不再需要的东西

examples.en: We are replacing the old windows with energy-efficient ones.
examples.zh: 我们正在用节能窗户替换旧窗户。

examples.en: Replacing the battery usually fixes the problem.
examples.zh: 更换电池通常能解决这个问题。

definition.en: taking someone’s position or role; acting as the person who was there before
definition.zh: 接替某人的职位或角色；顶替原来的人

examples.en: She is replacing the manager while he is on vacation.
examples.zh: 经理休假期间，她来顶替他。

examples.en: A new actor is replacing him in the show.
examples.zh: 这部剧里将由一位新演员接替他。

definition.en: the act or process of changing one thing for another (used as a gerund)
definition.zh: 更换／替换这一行为或过程（作动名词用）

examples.en: Replacing parts regularly can prevent accidents.
examples.zh: 定期更换零件可以预防事故。

extraExplanation: “replacing”是动词“replace”的现在分词/动名词形式，常用于进行时（be replacing）或作名词（Replacing… can…）。

易混词：
- replace：强调“取代/更换”，新东西成为原来的位置或功能。
- substitute：更强调“临时代替/替代品”，不一定永久取代。

summary.en: “Replait” means to braid something again, especially hair or cord.
summary.zh: replait 指把头发或绳带等“重新编辫/重新编织”。

definition.en: to braid (hair, rope, etc.) again; to plait anew, often after it has come loose
definition.zh: 把（头发、绳子等）重新编辫；再编一次（常指散开后重新编）

examples.en: After swimming, she replaited her hair into two neat braids.
examples.zh: 游完泳后，她把头发重新编成两条整齐的辫子。

examples.en: The decorative cord had unraveled, so they replaited it for the ceremony.
examples.zh: 装饰用的绳带散开了，所以他们为仪式把它重新编好。

extraExplanation: replait = re-（再次）+ plait（编辫/编织）。在美式英语里，plait 不如 braid 常用；因此 replait 也偏书面或较少见，日常更常说 rebraid。
拼写提示：replait 不是 "repeat"；它强调“重新编织/重新编辫”。

summary.en: Replan means to make a new plan or adjust an existing one.
summary.zh: replan 指重新制定计划或调整原有计划。

definition.en: to make a new plan, or change an existing plan after new information or problems appear
definition.zh: 重新制定计划；（因新情况或问题）调整原有计划

examples.en: We had to replan the trip because the flights were canceled.
examples.zh: 因为航班取消，我们不得不重新规划这次旅行。

examples.en: After the test results came in, the doctor replanned the treatment schedule.
examples.zh: 拿到检验结果后，医生重新调整了治疗安排。

examples.en: Let’s replan our day so we’re not rushing.
examples.zh: 我们把一天的安排重新规划一下，这样就不会太赶。

extraExplanation: “re-”是常见前缀，表示“再、重新”。因此 replan = re-（重新）+ plan（计划）。在正式写作中也常见表达：revise the plan（修订计划）、make a new plan（重新制定计划）。

summary.en: Replane means to plane something again, especially wood, to make it flat and smooth.
summary.zh: Replane 指把材料（尤其是木料）再刨一次，使其更平整光滑。

definition.en: to plane (a piece of wood) again to make it smooth, flat, or the right thickness
definition.zh: （木工）把木料再刨一次，使其更平整、光滑或达到合适厚度

examples.en: The tabletop warped a little, so the carpenter replained it and sanded it smooth.
examples.zh: 桌面有点翘曲，所以木匠把它重新刨平并打磨光滑。

examples.en: If the door still sticks, you may need to replane the edge slightly.
examples.zh: 如果门还是卡住，你可能需要把门边稍微再刨一下。

definition.en: to smooth or reshape a surface again using a plane or similar tool (more general/technical use)
definition.zh: （更泛指/技术用法）用刨子或类似工具再次修整、刨平表面

examples.en: After the repair, the metal surface was replained to remove uneven spots.
examples.zh: 修补后，金属表面又被重新修整，以去除不平整的地方。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再一次、重新”。“replane”是由 re- + plane（刨平）构成的动词，常见于木工或工艺语境。日常英语里更常说“plane it again / plane it down again”，所以你在普通对话中不一定常看到“replane”。

summary.en: “Replaned” usually means “planned again” (more commonly spelled **replanned**). Less commonly, it can mean “planed again” in woodworking (from **replane**).
summary.zh: “replaned” 通常想表达“重新计划”（更常见拼作 **replanned**）；较少见时也可指木工里“再刨一遍”（来自 **replane**）。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of **replan**: to make a new plan because the old one changed or didn’t work.
definition.zh: **replan** 的过去式/过去分词：因为原计划有变或行不通而**重新规划、重新计划**。

examples.en: We replanned the trip after the storm canceled our flight.
examples.zh: 航班因暴风雨取消后，我们重新规划了这次旅行。

examples.en: The team replanned the schedule to meet the new deadline.
examples.zh: 团队重新安排了进度表，以赶上新的截止日期。

definition.en: (less common) past tense/past participle of **replane**: to plane (smooth/flatten) a surface again, especially wood.
definition.zh: （较少见）**replane** 的过去式/过去分词：把表面（尤指木材）**再次刨平/刨光**。

examples.en: The carpenter replaned the tabletop to remove the scratches.
examples.zh: 木匠把桌面再刨了一遍以去掉划痕。

extraExplanation: “replaned” 这个拼写在现代英语里不太常见；表示“重新计划”时更标准的过去式通常写作 **replanned**（双写 l）。
如果你想表达木工里的“再刨一遍”，对应动词是 **replane**，过去式可写 **replaned**。需要结合上下文判断是哪一种意思。

summary.en: “Replaning” can mean planning again (more commonly spelled “replanning”) or, in woodworking, planing wood again to smooth it.
summary.zh: “replaning”可表示“重新规划”（更常见拼作“replanning”），也可指木工中“再刨平木材表面”。

definition.en: the act of planning again; making a new plan after changing goals or conditions (also commonly spelled “replanning”)
definition.zh: 重新规划；在目标或情况变化后再次制定计划（也常拼作“replanning”）

examples.en: After the budget cuts, the team spent a week replaning the project timeline.
examples.zh: 预算削减后，团队花了一周时间重新规划项目时间表。

examples.en: We’re replaning our trip because the weather looks bad.
examples.zh: 因为天气看起来不好，我们正在重新规划行程。

definition.en: present participle of “replane”: to plane a wooden surface again to make it smooth or level
definition.zh: （replane 的现在分词）再次刨平木材表面，使其更光滑或更平整

examples.en: The carpenter is replaning the door because it still sticks.
examples.zh: 木匠正在把门再刨一遍，因为它还是会卡住。

examples.en: Replaning the tabletop removed the scratches.
examples.zh: 把桌面再刨一遍去掉了划痕。

extraExplanation: “replaning”在日常英语里更常见的拼法是“replanning”（re- + planning），尤其在商业、项目管理语境中。
注意区分：和木工相关的“replane”（再刨平）拼写只有一个 n，因此动名词/现在分词常写作“replaning”。如果你想表达“重新规划”，写“replanning”更自然。

summary.en: “Replanned” means planned again or changed from an earlier plan; it’s also the past form of “replan.”
summary.zh: “replanned”表示“重新规划/对原计划做调整后的再规划”，也是动词 replan 的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: planned again; changed from an earlier plan.
definition.zh: 重新规划的；在原计划基础上再次制定或调整的。

examples.en: After the storm, the trip was replanned for next week.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，旅行改为下周重新规划。

examples.en: The project timeline was replanned to meet the new deadline.
examples.zh: 为了赶上新期限，项目时间表被重新规划了。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of replan: to plan again or change a plan.
definition.zh: replan 的过去式/过去分词：重新规划；对计划进行改动后再制定。

examples.en: We replanned the event because the venue was unavailable.
examples.zh: 因为场地不可用，我们重新规划了活动。

examples.en: They had replanned everything by the time we arrived.
examples.zh: 我们到的时候，他们已经把一切都重新规划好了。

extraExplanation: “re-” 是常见前缀，表示“再一次/重新”，如 rework（返工/重新做）、rewrite（重写）、rethink（重新思考）。因此 replan = plan again。
在正式写作里，常见被动结构：was/were replanned（被重新规划）。如果强调“改变安排”，也可用 rescheduled（重新排期）或 revised the plan（修订计划）。

summary.en: Replanning means planning again or making a new plan, usually because conditions have changed.
summary.zh: Replanning 指因情况变化而再次制定计划或重新规划。

definition.en: the act or process of making a new plan, or planning something again because the situation has changed
definition.zh: 重新规划；再制定计划（因情况变化而重新做计划）

examples.en: After the storm, the team began replanning the construction schedule.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，团队开始重新规划施工进度。

examples.en: Replanning is necessary when costs rise or deadlines shift.
examples.zh: 当成本上涨或截止日期改变时，就需要重新规划。

definition.en: the present participle of replan: making a new plan again
definition.zh: replan 的现在分词：正在重新制定计划

examples.en: We’re replanning the trip to avoid the holiday crowds.
examples.zh: 我们正在重新规划行程，以避开假期人潮。

examples.en: She is replanning her lessons for the new class level.
examples.zh: 她正在为新的班级水平重新规划课程。

extraExplanation: “replanning”常见于项目管理、工程、商业与政府文件中，比日常口语更正式。口语里也常用“plan again / redo the plan / revise the plan”。
词形来自“re-（再次）+ plan（计划）”。在写作中有时也会写作“re-planning”（较少见），意思相同。

summary.en: “Replans” means “makes a new plan again” or “changes the plan and plans it again.”
summary.zh: “replans”表示“重新制定计划/改订计划”（动词 replan 的第三人称单数）。

definition.en: to make a new plan for something; to change the plan and plan it again
definition.zh: 重新规划；改订计划（把原计划重新安排或调整）

examples.en: She replans the schedule when the client changes the deadline.
examples.zh: 当客户更改截止日期时，她会重新安排时间表。

examples.en: If it rains, he replans the picnic for next weekend.
examples.zh: 如果下雨，他就把野餐改计划到下周末。

extraExplanation: “replans”是动词“replan”的第三人称单数（he/she/it replans）。常见搭配：replan a trip / replan the project / replan the schedule。
词缀提示：re- 表示“再次、重新”，plan 表示“计划”。所以 replan = “重新计划”。
在工作场景里常和变化（changes）、延迟（delays）、资源调整（resources）一起出现，语气中性，强调根据新情况做调整。

summary.en: Replant means to plant something again, often after damage or in a new place.
summary.zh: replant 指“重新种植/重种”，常因受损或需要移栽而再次种下。

definition.en: to plant something again, often in a new place or after it has been removed
definition.zh: 重新种植；（常指移栽到别处或拔起后）再种回去

examples.en: We had to replant the flowers after the storm knocked them over.
examples.zh: 暴风雨把花刮倒后，我们不得不把它们重新种上。

examples.en: The farmer will replant the field in the spring.
examples.zh: 农民会在春天把这块地重新播种。

examples.en: Try to replant the seedling quickly so the roots don’t dry out.
examples.zh: 尽量快点把幼苗重新栽好，免得根部变干。

definition.en: to plant a crop again in the same area (often after a crop fails or is harvested early)
definition.zh: （在同一块地里）再次种植作物；（常指歉收、毁损或提前收割后）补种/重种

examples.en: If the first planting fails, they may replant with a hardier variety.
examples.zh: 如果第一次种植失败，他们可能会改用更耐受的品种来重种。

examples.en: Because of flooding, many families had to replant their rice.
examples.zh: 因为洪水，许多家庭不得不重种水稻。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再、重新”，加在动词前：replant = plant again。常见搭配：replant trees/flowers/seedlings（重栽树/花/幼苗）、replant a field（重种一块地）。
和 “transplant” 的区别：transplant 更强调“移栽/移植”（从一个地方移到另一个地方）；replant 强调“再种一次”（可以是移栽，也可以是同地重种）。

summary.en: Replantable means “able to be planted again,” often used for plants or seedlings that can survive being moved and replanted.
summary.zh: replantable 指“可再次种植的”，常用于能经受移栽并重新栽种的植物或幼苗。

definition.en: Able to be planted again, especially after being moved or removed (such as a seedling, plant, or crop).
definition.zh: 可再次种植的；（尤指移栽或拔起后）还能重新栽种的。

examples.en: These seedlings are replantable if you keep the roots moist.
examples.zh: 这些幼苗只要保持根部湿润，就可以重新栽种。

examples.en: Choose replantable native plants to help restore the garden after construction.
examples.zh: 选择可重新栽种的本土植物，有助于在施工后恢复花园。

extraExplanation: “replantable”由 re-（再、重新）+ plant（种植）+ -able（能够……的）组成，字面意思就是“能够被重新种植”。常见于园艺、农业、生态修复、苗圃等语境。
近义表达常用 “transplantable”（可移植/可移栽的，强调从一处移到另一处）或 “replantable”（强调再次种回去/补种）。在说明书或标签上也可能看到 “replant” 作动词（重新种植）。

summary.en: Replantation means planting again; in medicine, it also means surgically reattaching a completely detached body part.
summary.zh: replantation 指重新栽种；在医学上也可指对完全离断的肢体/组织进行再植（手术接回）。

definition.en: The act or process of planting something again, especially putting a plant back into soil after it has been removed.
definition.zh: 重新栽种；再种植（尤指把被移走的植物重新种回土里）。

examples.en: After the storm, the gardeners began the replantation of damaged trees.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，园丁们开始重新栽种受损的树木。

examples.en: Replantation can help a field recover after one crop fails.
examples.zh: 当一季作物歉收后，重新栽种可以帮助田地恢复生产。

definition.en: (Medicine) Surgical reattachment of a completely detached body part, such as a finger, hand, or tooth, to restore function and blood supply.
definition.zh: （医学）断离肢体（如手指、手、牙齿等）的再植术；把完全离断的部位通过手术重新接回并恢复血供与功能。

examples.en: The surgeon attempted replantation of the amputated finger.
examples.zh: 外科医生尝试对被截断的手指进行再植术。

examples.en: Successful replantation often requires microsurgery.
examples.zh: 成功的再植术通常需要显微外科手术。

extraExplanation: “replantation”由 re-（再次）+ plantation/plant（种植）构成，字面意思是“再次种植”。在日常园艺/农业语境中，多指把植物重新栽回去。
在医学语境里，“replantation”是较专门的术语，常与“(digital) replantation（断指再植）”搭配；更口语或更常见的说法有“reattachment（重新接回）”。

summary.en: “Replanted” means planted again (or describes something that has been planted again).
summary.zh: “Replanted”表示“重新种植”，也可形容“被重新种植过的”。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of replant) to plant something again, often in a new place or after it failed to grow.
definition.zh: （replant 的过去式/过去分词）再次种植（常指换地方种、或第一次没长好后重新种）。

examples.en: We replanted the flowers after the frost damaged them.
examples.zh: 霜冻把花冻坏后，我们又重新种了一遍。

examples.en: The farmer replanted the field with corn in spring.
examples.zh: 农民在春天把地重新种上了玉米。

definition.en: Used as an adjective: having been planted again.
definition.zh: 作形容词：被重新种植过的。

examples.en: The replanted trees need extra water for a few weeks.
examples.zh: 重新栽种的树需要额外浇水几周。

examples.en: These replanted seedlings are still adjusting to the new soil.
examples.zh: 这些重新移栽的幼苗还在适应新土壤。

extraExplanation: 在园艺/农业语境里，replant 常强调“重新种植”这一动作；如果更强调把植物从一个地方移到另一个地方，英语里也常用 transplant（移栽/移植）。两者有时会重叠，但 transplant 更突出“搬家、移根”。

summary.en: A replanter is a person or machine that replants plants or seeds.
summary.zh: replanter 指重新栽种植物或种子的人或机器。

definition.en: a person or a machine that replants something (puts plants or seeds into the ground again, often in a new place).
definition.zh: 重新栽种者；移栽机（指把植物或种子再次种下去的人或机器，常常是换到新的位置）。

examples.en: After the storm damaged the seedlings, the farmer hired a replanter to start over.
examples.zh: 暴风雨把幼苗毁了以后，农场主雇了人来重新栽种。

examples.en: The replanter moved the young trees into rows that would give them more sunlight.
examples.zh: 移栽机把小树移到一排排的位置，让它们能获得更多阳光。

extraExplanation: “replanter”来自 re-（再、重新）+ plant（种植）+ -er（做某事的人/物）。在农业语境里，它既可以指“负责补种/移栽的人”，也常用来指“移栽机、补种机”等设备。

summary.en: Replanting means planting something again, often by moving a plant or replacing crops.
summary.zh: replanting 指“重新种植/再栽种”，常用于移栽植物或灾后补种作物等情境。

definition.en: the act or process of planting something again, especially moving a plant to a new place or replacing crops
definition.zh: 重新种植；再栽种（尤指把植物移到新地方，或更换作物再种）

examples.en: Replanting helps the tree grow better after it outgrows its pot.
examples.zh: 重新栽种有助于树在长大、花盆太小之后长得更好。

examples.en: After the flood, farmers focused on replanting rice in the damaged fields.
examples.zh: 洪水过后，农民把重点放在受损稻田的重新播种上。

definition.en: planting again; putting a plant back into soil, often in a different spot
definition.zh: 重新种植；再把植物种回土里（常指换位置）

examples.en: She is replanting the flowers near the window for more sunlight.
examples.zh: 她正把花重新栽到窗边，好获得更多阳光。

examples.en: We replanting the seedlings too late can weaken them.
examples.zh: 太晚重新移栽幼苗可能会让它们变弱。

extraExplanation: 在园艺语境里，replanting 常常接近 transplanting（移栽/移植），但 replanting 更强调“再种一次”，原因可能是长势不好、位置不合适、灾害损坏后补种等；transplanting 更强调“从一个地方移到另一个地方”。
名词 replanting 常用于农业与生态修复：例如 replanting forests（补植/复植森林）、replanting mangroves（重新种植红树林）等。

summary.en: “Replants” usually means ‘plants again’ (3rd-person singular of replant) or ‘plants that were planted again’ (plural noun).
summary.zh: “replants”通常指“再次栽种”（replant 的第三人称单数），也可指“重新栽种的植物”（复数名词）。

definition.en: to plant something again, often in a new place (e.g., moving a young plant to improve its growth)
definition.zh: 把某物再种一次，常指移到新的地方重新栽种（如把幼苗移栽以便更好生长）

examples.en: She replants the seedlings after the last frost.
examples.zh: 最后一次霜冻过后，她把幼苗重新移栽。

examples.en: We replanted the tree farther from the house.
examples.zh: 我们把那棵树移到离房子更远的地方重新栽种。

definition.en: to put a body part back into its original place and attach it again (medical use, less common in everyday conversation)
definition.zh: （医学用语）把断离的身体部位重新接回原位并再植（较少用于日常对话）

examples.en: Surgeons replanted the patient’s finger after the accident.
examples.zh: 事故后，外科医生为患者的手指进行了再植。

definition.en: plants that have been planted again; the act or result of replanting (plural noun use)
definition.zh: 重新栽种的植物；重新栽种这一行为或结果（复数名词用法）

examples.en: These replants need extra water for a few days.
examples.zh: 这些重新移栽的植物需要多浇几天水。

extraExplanation: “replants”通常是动词“replant”的第三人称单数（He/she replants...），也可能是名词复数（the replants）。学习时可以先记住基础形式 replant（再次/重新栽种）。
园艺语境里，replant 常与 transplant（移栽/移植）接近：transplant 强调“从A处挖起移到B处”，replant 强调“再种一次/重新种下”，两者常可互换，但侧重点不同。

summary.en: Replaster means to apply plaster again to repair or renew a wall or surface.
summary.zh: replaster 指为修补或翻新而对墙面/表面重新抹灰。

definition.en: to cover a wall or surface with a new layer of plaster again, usually to repair damage or make it smooth
definition.zh: （给墙或表面）重新抹灰；再上一层灰（通常为修补破损或使其平整）

examples.en: They had to replaster the ceiling after the water leak.
examples.zh: 漏水后，他们不得不把天花板重新抹灰。

examples.en: The old house looks brighter now that the walls have been replastered.
examples.zh: 墙面重新抹灰后，这栋老房子看起来更明亮了。

extraExplanation: re- 是常见前缀，表示“再次/重新”，replaster = plaster（抹灰）+ re-（再一次）。常用于房屋翻修语境：墙面开裂、起皮或受潮后，可能需要先刮除松动部分、补基层，再重新抹灰并打磨、上漆。

summary.en: “Replate” is a rare verb meaning to plate something again (re-coat with metal) or to re-arrange food on a plate.
summary.zh: “replate”是个较少见的动词，指“重新电镀/重新镀层”或“重新摆盘”。

definition.en: (rare) To plate again; to put a new layer of metal (or a new coating) on something, or to arrange food on a plate again.
definition.zh: （罕用）再次电镀/镀上一层；（餐饮语境）把食物重新摆盘。

examples.en: The jeweler had to replate the ring because the gold coating wore off.
examples.zh: 金匠不得不把戒指重新电镀，因为金色涂层磨掉了。

examples.en: The chef decided to replate the dessert to make it look cleaner.
examples.zh: 主厨决定把甜点重新摆盘，让外观更干净利落。

extraExplanation: “replate”在日常英语里非常少见，更常见的表达是：metal 语境用 “re-plate / replate an object”（重新电镀）；餐饮语境常用 “re-plate the dish”（重新摆盘），有时也写作 “replate”。
很多学习者想写的其实是 “replete”（adj. 意为“充满的”），拼写很接近：replete /rɪˈpliːt/，而 replate 是 /riˈpleɪt/。如果你想表达“充满”，请告诉我，我可以给出 replete 的词条和用法对比。

summary.en: “Replated” means coated with metal again (or the past form of “replate”), often used for jewelry or metal items.
summary.zh: “replated”指“重新电镀/再镀一层金属的”（或 replate 的过去式），常用于珠宝或金属物品修复。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of replate) to coat something with a thin layer of metal again, usually to restore shine or protection.
definition.zh: （replate 的过去式/过去分词）给物品再次电镀/再镀上一层薄金属，通常用于恢复光泽或保护层。

examples.en: The jeweler replated the ring in gold to make it look new again.
examples.zh: 珠宝匠把戒指重新镀了一层金，让它看起来像新的一样。

examples.en: These utensils were replated after years of use.
examples.zh: 这些餐具使用多年后被重新电镀了。

definition.en: (adj.) having been plated again with metal.
definition.zh: （形容词）被重新镀过（金属）的。

examples.en: A replated necklace can look bright, but the coating may wear off over time.
examples.zh: 重新镀过的项链看起来很亮，但镀层可能会随着时间磨损。

examples.en: They sold replated silverware at a lower price than solid silver.
examples.zh: 他们以比纯银更低的价格出售重新镀过的银餐具。

extraExplanation: “replated”比较少见，常用于珠宝、电镀、金属修复等语境（如 gold-plated / silver-plated 的“再镀一层”）。
如果你想表达“重复的/反复的”，更常见的单词是 **repeated**（反复的、重复的）。拼写上 re**pl**ated 和 re**pe**ated 很容易打错。

summary.en: “Replates” means plates something again—most often re-coating metal with a new layer, or (in restaurants) arranging food on a plate again.
summary.zh: “replates”指“再次镀层/重新镀”，也可指餐饮中的“重新摆盘/重新装盘”。

definition.en: to cover (a piece of metal, jewelry, or an object) with a new thin layer of metal, especially by electroplating; to plate again
definition.zh: 给（金属、首饰或物品）重新镀上一层金属（尤指电镀）；再次镀层

examples.en: The jeweler replated the ring in gold to restore its shine.
examples.zh: 珠宝商把戒指重新镀金，让它恢复光泽。

examples.en: Old silverware can be replated instead of replaced.
examples.zh: 旧银器可以重新镀层，而不一定要更换。

definition.en: (food) to arrange and serve a dish again, usually more neatly or in a new style
definition.zh: （餐饮）把菜肴重新摆盘、重新装盘（通常更美观或换风格）

examples.en: The chef replated the dessert after the sauce spilled.
examples.zh: 酱汁洒了之后，主厨把甜点重新摆盘。

examples.en: We’ll replate the main course and send it out again.
examples.zh: 我们会把主菜重新装盘，再送出去。

extraExplanation: “replates”通常是动词“replate”的第三人称单数（he/she/it replated? 注意：过去式是 replated；第三人称现在式是 replates）。
很多学习者会把“replates”误写成“replaces”。两者意思不同：replaces=“替换/取代”，replates=“重新镀层/重新摆盘”。如果你想表达“取代”，正确拼写通常是 “replaces”。

summary.en: Replating means plating something again with a new metal coating.
summary.zh: Replating 指对物品再次镀层，用新的金属表层重新覆盖。

definition.en: the process of plating something again, usually by covering it with a new layer of metal (often by electroplating) to restore appearance or prevent corrosion
definition.zh: 再次镀层的过程；通常指用新的金属层（常用电镀）重新覆盖物品，以恢复外观或防止腐蚀

examples.en: The antique silverware needed replating because the old finish had worn away.
examples.zh: 这套餐具需要重新镀银，因为原来的表层已经磨损了。

examples.en: After years of use, the faucet was sent out for replating to stop the rust.
examples.zh: 用了很多年后，这个水龙头被送去重新电镀，以防继续生锈。

definition.en: re-plating something; putting a new metal coating on it again
definition.zh: 给某物再次镀层；重新镀上一层金属

examples.en: They are replating the door handles to match the new design.
examples.zh: 他们正在给门把手重新电镀，以配合新的设计。

examples.en: The shop specializes in replating old chrome parts.
examples.zh: 这家店专门做旧铬件的重新镀铬。

extraExplanation: “replating”常见于修复、汽车零件、古董金属器、五金件等语境。最常见的工艺是先去除旧镀层与锈蚀（清洗/抛光），再进行电镀（如镀铬、镀镍、镀银）。
在英语里也常写作“re-plating”（加连字符）来强调“再次”这一层意思。

summary.en: “Replay” means to play something again (verb) or a repeat showing/second game (noun).
summary.zh: “replay”既可作动词表示“重播/重赛”，也可作名词表示“回放/重赛”。

definition.en: to play (a game, match, scene, or recording) again; to show again
definition.zh: 重播；再播放；（比赛/游戏）重赛

examples.en: Could you replay that video? I missed the last part.
examples.zh: 你能把那段视频重播一下吗？我错过了最后一部分。

examples.en: The teams will replay the match next week because of the storm.
examples.zh: 由于暴风雨，两队将于下周重赛。

examples.en: The TV station replayed the interview in the evening.
examples.zh: 电视台在晚上重播了那段采访。

definition.en: a second playing of a game, match, scene, or recording; a repeat showing
definition.zh: 重播；回放；（比赛）重赛

examples.en: Let’s watch the replay of the goal.
examples.zh: 我们来看看这个进球的回放。

examples.en: The referee checked an instant replay before making the call.
examples.zh: 裁判在判罚前查看了即时回放。

examples.en: They announced a replay after the game ended in a tie.
examples.zh: 比赛打成平局后，他们宣布要进行重赛。

extraExplanation:
“Replay”在体育语境中很常见：
- replay（名词）= 回放/重赛
- instant replay = 即时回放（常用于裁判复核）
口语里也常说“run that back”（把刚才那段再放一遍），意思接近“replay it”。

summary.en: “Replayed” means played again (a recording/event) or played again as a rematch.
summary.zh: “replayed” 指把录音/事件再播放一次，或指比赛重赛。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of replay) to play (a recording, game, or event) again; to experience or show something again, often by watching/listening again.
definition.zh: （replay 的过去式/过去分词）再次播放（录音、比赛等）；重看/重听以再次经历或展示某事。

examples.en: I replayed the voicemail to catch every word.
examples.zh: 我把那段语音留言又播放了一遍，想听清每个词。

examples.en: She replayed the match highlights after dinner.
examples.zh: 晚饭后她又看了一遍比赛集锦。

examples.en: He replayed the moment in his mind all night.
examples.zh: 他整晚都在脑海里反复回想那一刻。

definition.en: In sports or games: (past tense of replay) to play a match/game again because the first result was unclear, tied, or invalid.
definition.zh: （体育/游戏）重赛（因为原结果不清楚、平局或无效）。

examples.en: The teams replayed the final after the referee’s mistake.
examples.zh: 因为裁判的失误，两队重赛了决赛。

examples.en: They replayed the game since the score was disputed.
examples.zh: 由于比分有争议，他们把比赛重赛了。

extraExplanation: “replayed” 常见于两种语境：①媒体/录音/视频“再次播放”；②体育比赛“重赛”。如果你要表达“反复回想（某事）”，英语里也很常见用法是 replay something in your mind（在脑海里重播/回放）。

summary.en: “Replaying” means playing or going through something again, either on a device (a song/video) or in your mind (a memory or conversation).
summary.zh: “replaying”表示“再次播放/重放”，也可以表示“在脑海里反复回想某段记忆或对话”。

definition.en: watching, listening to, or playing something again (the -ing form of “replay”)
definition.zh: 再次观看、收听或播放（“replay”的 -ing 形式）

examples.en: I’m replaying the song because I love the chorus.
examples.zh: 我在反复播放这首歌，因为我很喜欢副歌。

examples.en: She kept replaying the video to catch the small detail.
examples.zh: 她一直重放那段视频，想看清那个小细节。

definition.en: showing or acting out an event again, especially to remember it or think about it
definition.zh: 再次回想或重现某件事（尤指在脑海里反复回放以回忆或思考）

examples.en: He lay awake replaying the conversation in his mind.
examples.zh: 他躺着睡不着，在脑海里反复回想那段对话。

examples.en: After the interview, I kept replaying my answers and worrying.
examples.zh: 面试后我一直在脑中回放自己的回答，越想越担心。

extraExplanation: “Replay”在体育语境里常指“回放/慢动作回放”（instant replay），所以“replaying the goal/foul”就是把进球或犯规镜头再放一遍。
在学习语境里，“replaying”很常见：反复回放音频/视频来练听力或模仿发音（shadowing）。

summary.en: “Replays” can mean plays again (verb) or repeated showings/recorded reviews of something, especially in sports (noun).
summary.zh: “replays”既可作动词表示“再次播放”，也可作名词表示“重播/回放”，尤其常用于体育比赛的关键镜头回放。

definition.en: to play something again (for example, a song, video, or event recording)
definition.zh: 再次播放（例如歌曲、视频或事件的录制内容）

examples.en: She replays her favorite song every morning.
examples.zh: 她每天早上都会把最喜欢的歌再播放一遍。

examples.en: The app replays the last 10 seconds of audio.
examples.zh: 这个应用会回放最近10秒的音频。

definition.en: repeated showings or broadcasts of something already shown, especially on TV or online
definition.zh: 重播；复播（尤指电视或网络上已播内容的再次播放）

examples.en: The channel shows replays of the series on weekends.
examples.zh: 这个频道周末会重播这部剧。

examples.en: I watched the replays after missing the live show.
examples.zh: 我错过直播后看了重播。

definition.en: video shown again to review an important moment, especially in sports
definition.zh: 回放（尤指体育比赛中为查看关键瞬间而再次播放的视频）

examples.en: The referee checked the replay to see if it was a goal.
examples.zh: 裁判看了回放来确认是否进球。

examples.en: The replay clearly shows the ball went out of bounds.
examples.zh: 回放清楚地显示球出了界。

extraExplanation: 在体育语境里，replay 常指“即时回放/慢动作回放”（instant replay / slow-motion replay），用来帮助观众或裁判更清楚地判断关键动作。口语中也常说“Let’s see the replay.”（我们看看回放）。

summary.en: To file a pleading again in court, usually in a revised form.
summary.zh: 在法庭上重新提交（通常是修改后的）诉状/答辩。

definition.en: (Law) To plead again or file a new version of your legal pleading (such as a complaint or answer), usually to correct problems or add details after the court orders or allows it.
definition.zh: （法律）重新提出答辩／重新起诉；提交修改后的诉状（如起诉状或答辩状），通常是法院要求或允许后，为了纠正缺陷或补充细节。

examples.en: The judge ordered the plaintiff to replead the complaint with clearer facts.
examples.zh: 法官命令原告重新起诉，并把事实陈述得更清楚。

examples.en: After the motion to dismiss was granted, the company chose to replead rather than appeal.
examples.zh: 驳回动议获准后，该公司选择重新提交诉状，而不是上诉。

extraExplanation: “replead”主要用于英美法语境，常见于民事诉讼文件中。它通常意味着原来的诉状因事实不够具体、法律依据不清、或格式/程序问题而被要求修改后再提交。
常与“amend (the complaint/pleading)”意思接近；但“replead”更强调“重新提出/重新写一份”以符合要求，语域更偏正式法律用语。

summary.en: A legal order to redo pleadings because the earlier pleadings were defective or didn’t frame the issue properly.
summary.zh: 法律术语：因先前诉辩文书有缺陷或未能形成明确争点而命令当事人重新诉辩的程序/命令。

definition.en: (Law) In common-law pleading, a court order requiring the parties to plead again (start the pleadings over) because the previous pleadings were defective or did not properly present the real issue.
definition.zh: （法律）在英美普通法诉讼文书制度中，法院命令当事人“重新陈述/重新答辩”（重新进行诉辩），因为之前的诉辩文书有缺陷，或未能正确呈现争议焦点。

examples.en: The judge granted a repleader after finding that neither side’s pleadings raised a clear issue for trial.
examples.zh: 法官认为双方的诉辩都没有提出可供审理的明确争点，因此下令进行 repleader（重新诉辩）。

examples.en: Because the complaint and answer were both poorly drafted, the court ordered a repleader.
examples.zh: 由于起诉状和答辩状都写得不够规范，法院命令重新诉辩（repleader）。

extraExplanation: “repleader”是较古老、偏普通法传统的术语，多见于英美法历史文献或讨论传统“pleading（诉辩）”制度的语境；在现代程序法中，法院更常用的表达可能是“allow/require amended pleadings（允许/要求修改诉辩文书）”等。
词形上可理解为 re-（再）+ plead（诉辩）+ -er（名词化），但它不是“重新辩护的人”，而是指“重新诉辩这一程序/命令”。

summary.en: A legal term meaning pleading again or submitting an amended pleading in a lawsuit.
summary.zh: 法律术语，指在诉讼中重新诉辩或提交修改后的诉辩文书。

definition.en: (Law) the act of pleading again; filing a new or amended formal statement in a lawsuit (for example, after the court orders changes or the other side challenges your original pleading).
definition.zh: （法律）重新陈述诉辩；在诉讼中再次提交新的或修改后的诉状/答辩等正式文书（例如法院要求更正，或对方对原诉辩提出异议后）。

examples.en: The judge granted the motion to dismiss but allowed repleading within 30 days.
examples.zh: 法官准许驳回动议，但允许在30天内重新起诉/重新陈述诉辩。

examples.en: After the defendant pointed out errors, the plaintiff filed a repleading with clearer facts.
examples.zh: 被告指出错误后，原告提交了重新诉辩版本，把事实写得更清楚。

examples.en: Repleading can help narrow the issues before the case moves forward.
examples.zh: 重新诉辩有助于在案件继续推进前缩小争议焦点。

extraExplanation: 这是一个较正式、偏法律领域的词，常见于民事诉讼程序语境中。很多时候法院会“允许重新诉辩”（leave/permission to replead），意思是给当事人机会修改起诉状或答辩，补充事实、纠正法律依据或格式问题。
常见搭配：grant/allow repleading（准许/允许重新诉辩）、order repleading（命令重新诉辩）、repleading within X days（在X天内重新诉辩）、amended pleading（修正后的诉状/诉辩文书）。

summary.en: “Repleads” means “pleads again” in a legal case, usually by refiling or amending a pleading.
summary.zh: “repleads”指在法律案件中“重新陈述/重新提交诉状或答辩”。

definition.en: (Law) To plead again; to file a new or amended legal pleading in response to a court order or to fix problems in an earlier pleading.
definition.zh: （法律）重新答辩；在法院要求下重新提交或修改诉状/答辩状，以纠正先前文书的问题。

examples.en: After the judge dismissed the complaint with leave to amend, the plaintiff repleads with more specific facts.
examples.zh: 法官以“允许修改”的方式驳回起诉后，原告重新起诉并补充更具体的事实。

examples.en: The defendant repleads the affirmative defenses to match the amended complaint.
examples.zh: 被告重新提出抗辩事由，以对应修改后的起诉状。

extraExplanation: “replead”主要用于英美法语境，常见于民事诉讼程序中：法院可能会因“陈述不充分/不明确”等原因要求一方重新提交更清楚、更完整的诉状或答辩。
词形说明：repleads 是第三人称单数现在时（he/she/it repleads）。常见搭配：replead a complaint / replead claims / replead defenses。

summary.en: Replete (often misspelled “repleat”) means completely full or richly filled, especially in the phrase “replete with.”
summary.zh: Replete（常被误写为“repleat”）意为“装满的/充满的”，常见结构是“replete with（充满……）”。

definition.en: (Commonly spelled **replete**) completely full; filled to capacity.
definition.zh: （常拼作 **replete**）装满的；充满的；满到容量极限的。

examples.en: After the big meal, I felt replete and sleepy.
examples.zh: 大餐之后，我觉得吃得很饱，困困的。

examples.en: The pantry was replete with canned food and rice.
examples.zh: 储藏室里堆满了罐头和米。

definition.en: (Often used with **with**) richly supplied or full of something (ideas, details, stories, etc.).
definition.zh: （常与 **with** 连用）充满……的；富含……的（常指细节、故事、信息等）。

examples.en: Her speech was replete with practical advice.
examples.zh: 她的演讲充满了实用的建议。

examples.en: The novel is replete with vivid images of city life.
examples.zh: 这部小说充满了对城市生活的生动描写。

extraExplanation: “repleat”通常被视为“replete”的拼写变体/误拼；现代英语里标准拼法是 **replete**。
常见搭配：**be replete with + 名词**（充满……）。例如：*The report is replete with errors.*（报告错误很多。）
词源来自拉丁语 *replere*（填满），与 **complete**（完整的）在词形上有点相似，但意思不同。

summary.en: “repled” is not standard; it is usually a misspelling of “replied,” meaning “answered.”
summary.zh: “repled”不是标准拼写，通常是“replied”的误拼，意思是“回答/回复”。

definition.en: A common misspelling of “replied” (past tense/past participle of “reply”).
definition.zh: “replied”的常见拼写错误（reply 的过去式/过去分词）。

examples.en: Incorrect: She repled to my message.
examples.zh: 错误：She repled to my message.

examples.en: Correct: She replied to my message.
examples.zh: 正确：She replied to my message.

definition.en: (replied) Said or wrote an answer to someone.
definition.zh: （replied）回答了某人；作出回应（口头或书面）。

examples.en: He replied quickly, “Yes, I can help.”
examples.zh: 他很快回答说：“是的，我可以帮忙。”

examples.en: I emailed the company, and they replied the next day.
examples.zh: 我给公司发了邮件，他们第二天就回复了。

examples.en: She didn’t reply to my question.
examples.zh: 她没有回答我的问题。

extraExplanation: “repled”不是标准英文拼写。最可能想写的是“replied”。注意：reply 变过去式时，把 -y 改成 -i 再加 -ed → replied。
如果你本来想表达“击退/使反感”，那可能是想写“repelled”（repel 的过去式），意思不同。可以告诉我你的句子，我帮你确认。

summary.en: “Repledge” means to pledge something again, or (in finance) to pledge received collateral to secure your own borrowing.
summary.zh: “repledge”指再次抵押；在金融中也指把收到的抵押品再拿去质押，为自己借款担保。

definition.en: to pledge again; to offer something as a promise or as security for a loan a second time (or after it has already been pledged).
definition.zh: 再次抵押；把某物在已抵押过的情况下再一次作为承诺或贷款担保。

examples.en: If you repledge the ring, you’ll need to follow the pawn shop’s rules again.
examples.zh: 如果你把戒指再次抵押，你就得再次遵守当铺的规定。

examples.en: They repledged the same collateral after renewing the loan.
examples.zh: 他们在续贷后用同一笔抵押品再次设定质押。

definition.en: (finance) to pledge collateral that you received from someone else as security for your own borrowing.
definition.zh: （金融）把从他人处收到的抵押品再拿去质押，作为自己借款的担保。

examples.en: Some brokers can repledge clients’ securities to fund their own trades.
examples.zh: 一些券商可能会把客户的证券再质押，用来为自己的交易融资。

examples.en: The contract limits how much collateral the bank may repledge.
examples.zh: 合同限制银行可以再质押的抵押品额度。

extraExplanation: “repledge”在日常英语中不算常见，更常见的同类词是“rehypothecate”（再抵押/再质押，偏专业）。在金融语境里，repledge常涉及“用客户/对手方提供的抵押品去为自己的借款融资”，这会带来风险：如果中间机构出问题，原始提供抵押品的人可能会更难及时取回资产。因此很多合同会写明是否允许repledge，以及允许的比例/上限。

summary.en: “Repledged” means pledged again—either renewing a promise or (in finance) reusing pledged collateral as collateral again.
summary.zh: “repledged”表示“再次承诺/再次质押”；既可指重申誓言，也可指金融中将已质押的抵押品再拿去作抵押。

definition.en: (general) Pledged again; promised again, often after an earlier pledge was made or released.
definition.zh: （一般）再次发誓/再次承诺；在之前的誓言或抵押解除后又重新作出承诺。

examples.en: After the ceremony, they repledged their support for the community project.
examples.zh: 仪式结束后，他们再次承诺支持这个社区项目。

examples.en: He had repledged loyalty to the team after returning from a break.
examples.zh: 休息归来后，他再次向团队表达忠诚。

definition.en: (finance) Pledged (collateral) again—used when a bank or broker uses assets that were pledged to it as collateral for its own borrowing (re-hypothecation).
definition.zh: （金融）再质押（抵押品）；指银行或券商把客户已质押给它的资产再次拿去作为自身融资的担保（再抵押/再质押）。

examples.en: Some client securities were repledged to secure the firm’s short-term loan.
examples.zh: 部分客户证券被再质押，用来担保该公司的短期贷款。

examples.en: The contract explains whether and how collateral may be repledged.
examples.zh: 合同说明抵押品是否以及如何可以被再质押。

extraExplanation: “repledged”是动词“repledge”的过去式/过去分词。日常语境里多表示“再次承诺”；但在金融语境里更常见，尤其讨论券商/银行对抵押品的“再质押（re-hypothecation）”，这涉及风险与监管披露。

summary.en: “Repledger” means someone who reuses pledged collateral as security for another loan.
summary.zh: “repledger”指把已被质押给自己的抵押物再次拿去作担保的人或机构。

definition.en: a person or organization that repledges collateral (uses an asset pledged to them as security for their own borrowing).
definition.zh: 再质押者；把他人质押给自己的抵押物再次拿去作担保借款的个人或机构。

examples.en: In a secured loan, the broker may act as a repledger of the client’s securities.
examples.zh: 在担保贷款中，券商可能作为客户证券的再质押者。

examples.en: The contract limits the repledger’s right to reuse the collateral.
examples.zh: 合同限制再质押者再次使用该抵押物的权利。

extraExplanation: “repledger”多见于金融、担保与法律语境，尤其与“repledge（再质押）/ rehypothecation（再抵押/再质押）”相关：A把资产质押给B后，B又把这份资产（或其权利）拿去质押给C，从而形成链条。实际使用中更常见的词是“repledge（动词/名词）”或“rehypothecate（动词）”，而“repledger”属于较专门、较少见的名词形式。

summary.en: Repledge means to pledge something again—especially to reuse collateral as security, common in finance.
summary.zh: Repledge 指“再次抵押/再质押”，尤其常用于金融领域指将担保品再次作为抵押物。

definition.en: to pledge again; to give something as security (collateral) a second time, often by passing on collateral you received from someone else
definition.zh: 再次抵押；再质押（把某物再次作为担保品，常指把从他人处获得的抵押品再转押给第三方）

examples.en: The bank repledged the securities to raise short-term funding.
examples.zh: 银行将这些证券再质押，以筹集短期资金。

examples.en: The broker was not allowed to repledge the client’s collateral without permission.
examples.zh: 经纪商未经许可不得将客户的担保品再质押。

definition.en: to promise support or loyalty again
definition.zh: 再次郑重承诺（支持或忠诚等）

examples.en: After the election, the senator repledged her commitment to healthcare reform.
examples.zh: 选举后，这位参议员再次承诺推动医疗改革。

extraExplanation: “repledge”在日常英语里不常见，更常出现在金融/法律语境中，尤其是担保品（collateral）的“再质押/转押”。
你输入的“repledges”通常是动词第三人称单数（He/She repledges…）或名词复数（rare）。更常用的词形是 repledge（原形）和 repledged（过去式）。

summary.en: Repledging means pledging again—either renewing a promise or (in finance) using pledged collateral again for another obligation.
summary.zh: Repledging 指“再次宣誓/重新承诺”，也可指（金融）将已抵押的资产再次质押以担保另一项义务。

definition.en: to pledge something again; to make a new promise or commitment (often after a previous pledge)
definition.zh: 再次宣誓／再度承诺；重新作出承诺（常指在已有誓约之后）

examples.en: After the incident, the team held a meeting and repledged to follow the safety rules.
examples.zh: 事件之后，团队开会并再次承诺遵守安全规定。

examples.en: Many volunteers repledged their support for the community project.
examples.zh: 许多志愿者再次承诺支持这个社区项目。

definition.en: (finance) to pledge collateral again to secure another loan or obligation
definition.zh: （金融）将已作抵押的资产再次质押，以担保另一笔贷款或义务

examples.en: The broker was accused of repledging clients’ securities without clear permission.
examples.zh: 该经纪商被指控在未明确获得许可的情况下再次质押客户的证券。

examples.en: Some contracts limit repledging to reduce risk.
examples.zh: 有些合同会限制再次质押，以降低风险。

extraExplanation: “repledging”是动词“repledge”的动名词/现在分词形式，常见于正式或金融语境。
金融语境下的“repledge”（再质押）涉及抵押品的再利用：同一份资产被用来支持更多借款，可能提高流动性，但也会增加连锁风险；是否允许通常取决于合同条款与监管规定。

summary.en: Replenish means to fill up again or replace what has been used.
summary.zh: Replenish 指把用掉的东西补回来，使其再次充足或装满。

definition.en: to fill something up again; to replace what has been used so it becomes full or sufficient
definition.zh: 补充；重新เติม满；补足（已用掉的部分）

examples.en: Please replenish the water bottles before the meeting starts.
examples.zh: 请在会议开始前把水瓶补满。

examples.en: The store replenishes its shelves every morning.
examples.zh: 这家店每天早上都会补货上架。

examples.en: After a long walk, she drank juice to replenish her energy.
examples.zh: 走了很久之后，她喝果汁来补充体力。

definition.en: to become full again or return to a good level (often used with “itself” or in formal writing)
definition.zh: （常较正式）恢复到充足状态；重新充满

examples.en: Over time, the soil can replenish itself if it is cared for properly.
examples.zh: 如果妥善照料，土壤随着时间可以自我恢复肥力。

examples.en: Some natural resources replenish slowly.
examples.zh: 一些自然资源恢复得很慢。

extraExplanation: “replenish”常用于较正式或书面语：replenish supplies（补给物资）、replenish stock（补库存/补货）、replenish energy（补充能量）。日常口语里也常用 fill up（把……加满）、restock（补货）。
搭配提示：replenish + 物品/资源（water, supplies, stock, energy）；replenish A with B（用B来补充A），如 replenish fluids with water（用水补充体液）。

summary.en: “Replenished” means “filled again/restored,” or it’s the past form of “replenish” (to refill or replace what was used).
summary.zh: “replenished”表示“再次补充/恢复到原有水平”，也可作动词replenish的过去式/过去分词（补充、添满、补回用掉的）。

definition.en: filled again; restored to a previous level or amount (often used for supplies, energy, or resources).
definition.zh: 再次补充的；恢复到原有水平的（常指物资、精力、资源等）。

examples.en: The water bottles were replenished before the hike began.
examples.zh: 远足开始前，水瓶都被补满了。

examples.en: After a good night’s sleep, she felt replenished and ready to work.
examples.zh: 睡了一晚好觉后，她觉得精力恢复了，准备工作了。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “replenish”: to fill again or replace what has been used.
definition.zh: “replenish”的过去式/过去分词：补充；添满；补回用掉的部分。

examples.en: They replenished the pantry with rice, beans, and oil.
examples.zh: 他们往食品储藏柜里补充了大米、豆子和食用油。

examples.en: The store replenished its stock after the holiday rush.
examples.zh: 节日抢购潮过后，这家店补充了库存。

extraExplanation: “replenish”常见搭配：replenish supplies/stock（水、食物、库存等）；replenish energy（补充体力/精力）；replenish nutrients（水分/营养）。
词感对比：fill强调“把东西装满”；replenish更强调“用掉之后再补回、恢复到原来的量”。

summary.en: A replenisher is someone or something that refills, replaces, or restores what has been used up.
summary.zh: replenisher指“补充、补给、恢复消耗”的人或事物。

definition.en: A person or thing that refills or restores something (such as a supply, energy, or moisture).
definition.zh: 补充者；补给物；使……恢复/补足的事物（如补给、能量或水分的补充来源）。

examples.en: Water is the best replenisher after a long workout.
examples.zh: 长时间锻炼后，水是最好的补充品。

examples.en: The company hired extra staff as a replenisher for the busy season.
examples.zh: 公司在旺季雇了额外员工来补充人手。

extraExplanation: “replenisher”来自动词replenish（补充、使恢复充足）+ 名词后缀-er（表示“做某事的人/物”）。在日常英语里，它不算特别常见，更常见的说法是“something that replenishes…”或直接用replenish作动词。
在零售与供应链语境中，replenisher有时指“补货员/补货系统”（负责把缺货商品补回货架或库存）。在保健/护肤语境中，也可能指“补水/修复类产品”，如skin replenisher。

summary.en: Replenishers are people or things that refill, restore, or resupply something.
summary.zh: Replenishers 指“补充者/补给物”，即用来补足、恢复或补货的人或事物。

definition.en: People or things that replenish (fill up again, restore, or replace what has been used).
definition.zh: 补充者；补给物；使（资源、库存、能量等）恢复或补足的人或事物。

examples.en: Water stations are important replenishers for runners during a marathon.
examples.zh: 在马拉松比赛中，补水站对跑者来说是重要的补给来源。

examples.en: In the hospital, the pharmacy team acts as replenisher of essential medicines.
examples.zh: 在医院里，药房团队承担着补充关键药品的角色。

examples.en: Some brands sell “replenishers” as refill packs for soap or detergent.
examples.zh: 有些品牌把洗手液或洗衣液的补充装称为“replenishers（补充装）”。

extraExplanation: “replenishers” 是名词复数，单数是 “replenisher”。它来自动词 “replenish”（补充、补足、恢复），加上表示“做某事的人/物”的后缀 “-er”。因此字面意思就是“用来补充的东西/负责补充的人”。
在商业与库存管理语境里，replenisher 常指“负责补货的人或系统”；在零售与日用品语境里，也可能指“补充装/替换装”（某些品牌用法偏营销）。

summary.en: “Replenishes” means fills up again or restores what has been used (supplies, stock, energy, etc.).
summary.zh: “replenishes”表示把用掉的东西重新补足或恢复（如补货、补充资源/体力等）。

definition.en: (of a person, process, or thing) fills something up again; restores a supply that has been used.
definition.zh: （人、过程或事物）把……重新补满；补充已消耗的供应。

examples.en: The store replenishes its shelves every morning.
examples.zh: 这家店每天早上都会把货架补满。

examples.en: Drinking water replenishes fluids after exercise.
examples.zh: 运动后喝水能补充体液。

examples.en: The company replenishes stock when demand increases.
examples.zh: 当需求上升时，公司会补充库存。

definition.en: restores strength, energy, or a good condition again.
definition.zh: 恢复（体力、精力或良好状态）；使重新充沛。

examples.en: A short nap replenishes my energy.
examples.zh: 小睡一会儿能恢复我的精力。

examples.en: Time in nature replenishes her spirit.
examples.zh: 在大自然里待一段时间能让她重获精神力量。

extraExplanation: “replenishes”是动词“replenish”的第三人称单数形式（he/she/it replenishes）。常见搭配：replenish supplies/stock/water/nutrients/energy。
和“refill”相比：refill更偏“把容器再装满”（如refill a bottle）；replenish更常用于“补充供应、库存或资源”，语气更正式一些。

summary.en: “Replenishing” means refilling or restoring something that has been used up (supplies, stock, energy, etc.).
summary.zh: “replenishing”指把用掉或减少的东西补回去，使之恢复到充足/满的状态（如物资、库存、精力等）。

definition.en: restoring something that has been used up by adding more; refilling
definition.zh: 补充的；补给的；把用完的东西加回去（再装满）

examples.en: Drinking water is replenishing after a long run.
examples.zh: 长跑后喝水很能补充体力和水分。

examples.en: The store is replenishing its shelves every morning.
examples.zh: 这家店每天早上都在补货。

definition.en: the act of adding more to bring something back to a full or good level; refilling
definition.zh: 补充；补给；恢复到充足/良好水平（的行为）

examples.en: Replenishing supplies is important before a storm.
examples.zh: 暴风雨来临前补充物资很重要。

examples.en: Regular replenishing of soap keeps the bathroom ready for guests.
examples.zh: 定期补充洗手液能让卫生间随时接待客人。

definition.en: present participle of “replenish”: adding more to make something full again; restoring
definition.zh: replenish 的现在分词：补充，使再次充满；恢复

examples.en: They are replenishing the fridge with fresh food.
examples.zh: 他们正在往冰箱里补充新鲜食物。

examples.en: Sleep helps in replenishing your energy.
examples.zh: 睡眠有助于补充精力。

extraExplanation: “replenish”常见搭配：replenish supplies/stock（补给/补货），replenish energy（补充精力），replenish water in the body（补水）。在职场/零售里“replenishing”经常指员工给货架“补货”。
词形提示：re-（再、重新）+ plen（满，和 plenty/complete 相关）。因此核心感觉是“把缺的补回到满”。
近义词辨析：refill 更口语、偏“把容器装满”（refill a bottle）；restock 偏“库存补齐”（restock a warehouse）。replenish 语气更正式，也常用于能量、资源等抽象事物。

summary.en: “Replenishingly” means “in a way that restores or refills.” It’s rare in everyday English.
summary.zh: “replenishingly”意为“以补充/恢复/重新补给的方式”。在日常英语中很少使用。

definition.en: In a way that replenishes something; so as to restore, refill, or renew (often used about energy, supplies, or strength).
definition.zh: 以补充、恢复或重新补给的方式；起到“补充/补给/恢复”作用地（常用于精力、物资或体力等）。

examples.en: After a long hike, we drank water and ate fruit replenishingly.
examples.zh: 长途徒步后，我们喝水吃水果，以补充体力和水分。

examples.en: She spoke calmly, almost replenishingly, and the room felt less tense.
examples.zh: 她平静地说话，几乎有种“让人恢复精神”的效果，房间里的紧张感也减轻了。

extraExplanation: 这个词非常少见，很多情况下英语母语者会更自然地说：in a replenishing way / in a restorative way，或直接用动词 replenish（补充）来表达。
构词上是 replenish（补充）+ -ing（形容词/分词用法）+ -ly（副词）。写作中如果要追求更常见、更地道的表达，可以考虑用 restoratively（恢复性地）或 refreshingly（令人清爽/提神地，语义更偏“清新提神”）。

summary.en: Replenishment means refilling or replacing what has been used, or the new supply that does this.
summary.zh: replenishment 指把消耗的东西重新补足的过程，也可指用于补足的一批新补给/补货。

definition.en: the act of filling something up again; the process of replacing what has been used or consumed
definition.zh: 补充；补给；再补足（把用掉或消耗的东西重新补回来）

examples.en: The store is waiting for replenishment of milk and eggs.
examples.zh: 商店正在等牛奶和鸡蛋的补货。

examples.en: Regular water replenishment is important after exercise.
examples.zh: 运动后定期补充水分很重要。

examples.en: The lake depends on rainfall for replenishment each year.
examples.zh: 这个湖每年依靠降雨来补给水量。

definition.en: a new supply of goods or materials that replaces what is running low
definition.zh: 补给物；补货（用来补上库存不足的一批新货/新材料）

examples.en: A replenishment arrived early in the morning.
examples.zh: 一批补货一大早就到了。

examples.en: We requested a replenishment of medical supplies.
examples.zh: 我们申请补充一批医疗物资。

extraExplanation: “replenishment”来自动词“replenish”（补充、使充足）+ 名词后缀“-ment”（表示动作/结果）。在商业里常见于“inventory replenishment（库存补货）”，在健康语境里常说“fluid replenishment（补充体液/水分）”。

summary.en: Replenishments are fresh supplies added to refill what’s been used, or the process of refilling/restoring.
summary.zh: replenishments 指为补足已消耗的物品而加入的新补给，也可指补充/补足的过程。

definition.en: Fresh supplies added to replace what has been used, lost, or sold.
definition.zh: （被用掉、丢失或售出的东西的）补充品；补给；补货

examples.en: The store ordered replenishments of milk and bread after the storm.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，这家商店订购了牛奶和面包来补货。

examples.en: Regular replenishments keep the medical kit ready for emergencies.
examples.zh: 定期补充物资能让急救包随时应对紧急情况。

definition.en: The act or process of replenishing; refilling or restoring something to a desired level.
definition.zh: 补充的行为或过程；补足；恢复到需要的水平

examples.en: The replenishments of water in the tanks happen overnight.
examples.zh: 水箱的补水通常在夜间进行。

examples.en: We scheduled replenishments of office supplies every Friday.
examples.zh: 我们安排每周五补充办公用品。

extraExplanation: “replenishments”是“replenishment”的复数形式，常用于商业、库存管理与物流语境，指“补货/补给的批次或次数”。在口语中，人们也常直接说“restocking”或“refill”。
词根提示：re-（再次）+ plen（满，如 plenty/plentiful），核心意思是“把东西重新补满”。

summary.en: Replete means fully filled or richly supplied, often used in formal writing (replete with…).
summary.zh: replete 指“充满的、很丰富的”，常用于较正式的表达（replete with…）。

definition.en: fully filled; having plenty of something (often used with “with”).
definition.zh: 充满的；装得满满的；（常与 with 连用）富有……的。

examples.en: The pantry was replete with rice and canned food.
examples.zh: 储藏室里堆满了大米和罐头食品。

examples.en: After the festival, the streets were replete with music and laughter.
examples.zh: 节日过后，街道上充满了音乐和笑声。

definition.en: to fill completely; to satisfy fully (now less common).
definition.zh: 使充满；使完全满足（较少用）。

examples.en: A warm meal can replete a tired traveler.
examples.zh: 一顿热饭能让疲惫的旅人完全满足。

extraExplanation: “replete”常见搭配是 **be replete with + 名词**，语气比“full of”更正式、更书面，强调“充盈、丰盛”。
词源上来自拉丁语“repletus”（填满的）。在文学或正式写作中，你可能会看到如“a mind replete with memories（充满回忆的心灵）”这种表达。

summary.en: “Repletely” means “completely; fully,” often in a literary or formal style.
summary.zh: “repletely”表示“完全地、充分地”，多见于较正式或文学语境。

definition.en: (Literary) completely; fully; in a richly supplied way.
definition.zh: （文学用语）完全地；充分地；丰盛地。

examples.en: The shelves were repletely stocked with food for the winter.
examples.zh: 架子上为过冬储满了食物。

examples.en: The garden was repletely filled with roses and lavender.
examples.zh: 花园里满是玫瑰和薰衣草。

definition.en: (Less common) to the point of being full or satisfied (often after eating).
definition.zh: （较少见）饱足地；吃得很撑、很满足地。

examples.en: After the banquet, the guests sat repletely and talked late into the night.
examples.zh: 宴会后，客人们吃得很饱，坐着聊到深夜。

extraExplanation: “repletely”来自形容词“replete”（充满的、充足的），常见于较正式或文学性的描写中。日常口语里更常用“completely / fully / richly / abundantly”。
它的语气往往带有“充盈、富足”的画面感，适合形容空间、书架、花园、生活等“被填满”的状态。

summary.en: Repleteness means the state of being full, abundant, or (more formally) complete.
summary.zh: Repleteness 指“充足、满满的状态”，也可较正式地表示“完整性”。

definition.en: the state of being full or well supplied; abundance
definition.zh: 充足；满满的状态；富足

examples.en: The repleteness of the pantry meant we didn’t need to shop for weeks.
examples.zh: 储藏室的充足意味着我们好几周都不用购物。

examples.en: She felt a quiet repleteness after finishing the long project.
examples.zh: 完成这个长期项目后，她感到一种安静的充实感。

definition.en: the quality of being complete or thoroughly filled (less common, more formal)
definition.zh: 完整性；充满到彻底的程度（较少见、较正式）

examples.en: The report aimed for repleteness, covering every major risk.
examples.zh: 这份报告力求完整性，涵盖所有主要风险。

examples.en: In the poem, repleteness suggests a world overflowing with detail.
examples.zh: 在这首诗里，“repleteness”暗示一个细节满溢的世界。

extraExplanation: “repleteness”是比较少见的名词，来自形容词“replete”（充满的、富足的）+ “-ness”。日常英语里更常用“fullness / completeness / abundance”，写作或较正式语境才可能见到“repleteness”。

summary.en: Repleteness means fullness/abundance, or completeness; “repletenesses” is its rare plural form.
summary.zh: repleteness 指“充满、丰盈”或“完整、圆满”；repletenesses 是其罕见的复数形式。

definition.en: the state of being full; abundance (often used in literary or formal writing)
definition.zh: 充满；丰盈；富足（多用于文学或正式语境）

examples.en: After the harvest, the barns had a feeling of repleteness.
examples.zh: 丰收之后，谷仓里有一种充盈富足的感觉。

examples.en: She spoke with a repleteness of detail that made the story vivid.
examples.zh: 她讲述得细节饱满，使故事格外生动。

definition.en: the state of being complete or fully developed
definition.zh: 完整；圆满；充分发展

examples.en: The portrait gained repleteness as he added shadows and texture.
examples.zh: 他加入阴影与质感后，这幅肖像变得更完整饱满。

examples.en: The plan lacks repleteness without a clear budget.
examples.zh: 没有明确预算，这个计划就谈不上完善。

extraExplanation: “repletenesses” 是名词 “repleteness” 的复数形式，但非常少见；英语里这种抽象名词通常不常用复数，除非强调“多种层面的充盈/多处的充实感”。
词源与构词：replete（充满的） + -ness（名词后缀），因此语感偏文学、修辞或评论性写作。

summary.en: Repletion means the state of being full or the process of filling up again.
summary.zh: Repletion 指“充满/饱足的状态”，也可指“再填满、补充”的过程。

definition.en: The state of being full; complete satisfaction (often after eating).
definition.zh: 充满；饱足（常指吃饱后的满足感）。

examples.en: After the big dinner, she felt a pleasant sense of repletion.
examples.zh: 大餐过后，她感到一种愉快的饱足感。

examples.en: He leaned back in repletion and thanked the host.
examples.zh: 他饱足地靠在椅背上，向主人道谢。

definition.en: The act or process of filling something up again; replenishment (more formal/rare).
definition.zh: 再填满；补充（较正式/较少见）。

examples.en: The repletion of the reservoir depends on spring rains.
examples.zh: 水库的再充满取决于春季降雨。

examples.en: Doctors focused on fluid repletion for the dehydrated patient.
examples.zh: 医生把重点放在为脱水患者补充液体上。

extraExplanation: 词源上与 replete（“充满的；使充满”）同源，来自拉丁语 repletus（“装满的”）。在文学或较正式的写作中，repletion 常用来表达“饱足后的慵懒/满足”，语气比 full 更书面。

summary.en: “Repletions” is the plural of “repletion,” meaning (1) the feeling of being pleasantly full after eating, or (2) abundance/fullness in supply.
summary.zh: “repletions”是“repletion”的复数，意思是（1）吃饱后的饱足感，（2）数量上的充足、富足。

definition.en: the state of being full, especially after eating; satiety
definition.zh: （尤指吃完后）饱腹、吃撑的状态；饱足感

examples.en: After the big dinner, she leaned back in happy repletion.
examples.zh: 大餐之后，她满足地靠在椅背上，满是饱足感。

examples.en: He felt a heavy repletion and decided to skip dessert.
examples.zh: 他觉得肚子很撑，于是决定不吃甜点了。

definition.en: an abundant supply; fullness in amount
definition.zh: 充足；富足（数量上的“满”）

examples.en: The garden showed repletion in summer, with flowers everywhere.
examples.zh: 夏天的花园一片繁盛，到处都是花，显得十分富足。

examples.en: The report described a repletion of resources in the region.
examples.zh: 报告称该地区资源非常充足。

extraExplanation: “repletions”是名词复数形式，单数是“repletion”。在现代英语中更常见的是用“fullness / satiety（饱足）”或“abundance（充足）”。
词源来自拉丁语 re-（再、回）+ plere（填满），核心意象是“把东西填满”。文学或较正式写作里更常用。

summary.en: Repletive is a rare term for a “dummy/filler” word in grammar (like “it” or “there”); it can also (rarely) mean “filling; full.”
summary.zh: Repletive 多用于（较旧/较正式的）语法术语，指“虚义/填充词”（如 it、there）；也可（很少）表示“填满的/补足的”。

definition.en: (Grammar, especially in older or formal descriptions) a word used mainly to fill a required position in a sentence, without adding much meaning—often called an “expletive.” Common examples are “it” in “It is raining” and “there” in “There is a problem.”
definition.zh: （语法，尤见于较旧或较正式的描述）主要用于填补句子所需位置、而不增加多少实义的词；常被称为“expletive（填充词/形式主语等）”。常见如“It is raining”中的 it，以及“There is a problem”中的 there。

examples.en: In “There is a book on the table,” “there” is a repletive that helps start the sentence.
examples.zh: 在“There is a book on the table”中，there 是一个 repletive，用来帮助句子起头。

examples.en: Some grammar books use “repletive” for “dummy it,” as in “It seems that he’s right.”
examples.zh: 一些语法书用 repletive 指“虚义 it”，如“It seems that he’s right.”

definition.en: (Rare) serving to fill up or make something complete; full.
definition.zh: （罕见）用于“填满/补足”；充满的。

examples.en: The term is rarely used today in this sense; “replete” is much more common.
examples.zh: 这个含义在现代英语中很少用；更常见的是 replete。

extraExplanation: “repletive”来自拉丁语词根，和“replete（充满的）”同源。在语法里它强调“填充位置”的功能。现代语言学与教学中更常用“expletive”或“dummy subject（虚主语）/dummy there”。
注意区分：语法里的“expletive/dummy”不等于“脏话/粗口”（虽然“expletive”在口语里也可指咒骂语）。语法意义是中性的。

summary.en: “Repletively” means “abundantly; in a fully supplied way,” but it is very rare today.
summary.zh: “repletively”意为“充裕地、充满地”，但在现代英语中非常少见。

definition.en: In a full or well-supplied way; abundantly (very rare in modern English).
definition.zh: 以充满的、富足的方式；充裕地（现代英语中很少用）。

examples.en: The shelves were repletively stocked for the holiday rush.
examples.zh: 为了节日抢购潮，货架被补得非常充足。

examples.en: In older writing, “repletively” could describe a table set repletively with food.
examples.zh: 在较早的写法中，“repletively”可用来形容餐桌上食物摆得十分丰盛。

extraExplanation: “repletively”源自形容词“replete”（充满的、富足的），但在现代英语里非常罕见。日常表达更常用“fully / abundantly / richly / well-stocked”。
它很容易与“repetitively”（反复地）混淆；两者拼写相近但意思不同。若你想表达“反复地”，通常应使用“repetitively”。

summary.en: Repletory (rare) means “replenishing/restorative,” and can also mean a restorative food or medicine.
summary.zh: repletory（罕见）意为“补充的/滋补恢复的”，也可指“滋补的食物或药物”。

definition.en: serving to fill up, replenish, or make something full again; restorative (now rare/archaic).
definition.zh: 用于“填满、补充、使恢复充盈的”；有滋补、恢复作用的（现多为罕见/古旧用法）。

examples.en: After the long walk, she drank a repletory broth to regain her strength.
examples.zh: 长途步行后，她喝了一碗滋补的清汤来恢复体力。

examples.en: The old text recommends repletory foods for people who are weak after illness.
examples.zh: 那本古书建议病后虚弱的人吃些“补益、恢复元气”的食物。

definition.en: a replenishing or restorative medicine/food; something that helps restore strength (rare/archaic).
definition.zh: 补充/滋补之物；用于恢复体力的药物或食物（罕见/古旧用法）。

examples.en: The physician prescribed a simple repletory: warm broth and rest.
examples.zh: 医生开了一个简单的“滋补方案”：热汤加休息。

extraExplanation: repletory 来自拉丁语词根 replet-（意为“装满、充满”，与 replete 同源）。在现代英语里更常见的是 replete（adj. 充满的）或 replenish（v. 补充）。
这个词常出现在较早的医学或养生语境中，指“补益、回补体力”的食物/药物；日常现代写作中用它会显得很古雅，通常改用 restorative、nourishing、replenishing 更自然。

summary.en: Repleve means to recover goods through a legal process (replevin), or to have seized goods released after providing security.
summary.zh: Repleve 指通过法律程序（replevin）取回被占有/扣押的动产，或在提供担保后使被扣押财物获准释放。

definition.en: (Law) To get back property (especially goods) that was taken or held, by using a legal process called replevin.
definition.zh: （法律）通过“返还诉讼/取回动产诉讼（replevin）”等法律程序取回被扣押、被占有或被不当持有的财物（尤指动产）。

examples.en: The company tried to repleve the equipment that had been seized.
examples.zh: 该公司试图通过法律程序取回被扣押的设备。

examples.en: He filed a claim to repleve his car after it was wrongfully held.
examples.zh: 他的车被不当扣留后，他提出申请以取回车辆。

definition.en: (Less common) To release something from seizure after security (a guarantee) is provided.
definition.zh: （较少见）在提供担保后，使被扣押的财物解除扣押、获准释放。

examples.en: The court allowed the goods to be repleved once a bond was posted.
examples.zh: 一旦缴纳保证金，法院允许货物解除扣押并获释。

extraExplanation: “repleve”主要见于英美法语境，日常英语里很少用，更常见的相关词是“replevin”（名词：返还动产诉讼）和“replevy”（动词：取回/解除扣押）。
核心含义是“通过法院程序取回被他人占有的动产”，与一般的“recover/get back”不同，它强调法律手段与财产争议。

summary.en: A legal adjective meaning personal property can be recovered through a replevin lawsuit.
summary.zh: 法律用语，指动产可通过“返还原物之诉”（replevin）依法取回。

definition.en: (Law) able to be recovered by a legal action called replevin (a lawsuit to get back personal property that was wrongfully taken or held).
definition.zh: （法律）可通过“返还原物之诉”（replevin：请求返还被非法扣留的动产的诉讼）取回的；可被依法追回的（指动产）。

examples.en: In some cases, goods seized by mistake may be repleviable.
examples.zh: 在某些情况下，被错误扣押的货物可能属于可通过返还原物之诉取回的财产。

examples.en: The court considered whether the property was repleviable under state law.
examples.zh: 法院审查该财产在州法下是否属于可依法提起返还原物之诉取回的财产。

extraExplanation: “repleviable”主要出现在英美法语境的财产/诉讼讨论中，属于较罕见的法律用语。日常英语更常用的说法是“can be recovered (through a replevin action)”或“can be reclaimed.”
replevin 通常针对“动产”（personal property，如货物、车辆等），而不是不动产（real property，如土地、房屋）。

summary.en: “Replevied” means “recovered property through a legal process (replevy), often by posting a bond.”
summary.zh: “replevied”指“通过法律程序（通常缴纳保证金）取回被扣押或被非法占有的动产”。

definition.en: (legal) Past tense/past participle of “replevy”: to recover goods that were taken or held unlawfully, usually by providing a security deposit (bond) until a court decides the case.
definition.zh: （法律用语）“replevy”的过去式/过去分词：通过提供担保（金）取回被非法扣押或占有的动产，待法院最终裁决。

examples.en: The tenant replevied the seized furniture after posting a bond.
examples.zh: 租客在缴纳保证金后，取回了被扣押的家具。

examples.en: The goods were replevied while the ownership dispute was still pending in court.
examples.zh: 在所有权纠纷仍在审理期间，这批货物已被依法取回。

extraExplanation: “replevied”多见于英美法语境，常与“bond（保证金/保释金）”“seized (property)（被扣押的财物）”“wrongful taking（不当扣押/侵占）”等搭配。
在现代日常英语中很少使用；更常出现在法院文件、律师函或新闻报道的法律细节里。
相关名词是“replevin”，指“返还原物之诉/取回被扣押动产的诉讼程序”。

summary.en: “Replevies” is the present-tense form of the legal verb “replevy,” meaning to recover property through a court process.
summary.zh: “replevies”是法律动词“replevy”的一般现在时形式，指通过法院程序取回被扣押或占有的财物。

definition.en: (law) takes back goods that were taken or held by another person, after giving security and following a court process.
definition.zh: （法律）在提供担保并经过法院程序后，取回被他人扣押或占有的财物。

examples.en: The company replevies the equipment after posting a bond.
examples.zh: 公司在缴纳保证金后，通过返还诉讼取回了设备。

examples.en: If the landlord wrongfully keeps your property, a court may allow you to replevy it.
examples.zh: 如果房东不当扣留你的财物，法院可能允许你通过返还诉讼将其取回。

extraExplanation: “replevy / replevies”主要用于英美法语境，常见于财物被扣押（例如执行、扣押令、纠纷占有）后，权利人通过法院程序要求“返还动产”。
词形上：replevy（原形），replevies（第三人称单数现在时：he/she/it replevies；也可作名词 replevin，指“返还诉讼/返还请求”这一程序本身）。

summary.en: Replevin is a legal process to recover specific personal property from someone who is holding it.
summary.zh: Replevin 指通过法律程序取回被他人占有的特定动产（返还动产之诉）。

definition.en: a legal action (lawsuit) used to get personal property back from someone who is holding it, often while the court decides who has the better right to it
definition.zh: （法律）返还动产之诉：通过诉讼要求他人返还其占有的动产，常用于在法院最终判定权利归属前先取回财物

examples.en: The lender filed a replevin action to recover the car after the borrower stopped making payments.
examples.zh: 借款人停止还款后，贷款方提起返还动产之诉以取回汽车。

examples.en: The court granted replevin, and the equipment was returned pending trial.
examples.zh: 法院准许返还动产之诉救济，设备在审理期间先行返还。

definition.en: to demand the return of personal property through a legal process (to bring a replevin action)
definition.zh: （法律）通过诉讼程序要求返还动产；提起返还动产之诉

examples.en: The company decided to replevin the computers that were never paid for.
examples.zh: 公司决定对未付款的电脑提起返还动产之诉以取回。

extraExplanation: “Replevin”主要用于英美法语境，常见于财产与担保交易（例如车辆、设备、租赁物）纠纷。它通常针对“动产”（personal property，如车、机器），而不是不动产（房屋、土地）。
在很多地区，replevin 可能允许“先取回、后审理”（在满足一定条件并可能提供保证金/担保的情况下），因此与一般的“索赔损害赔偿”不同，它的核心是“取回特定物”。
相关法律文件里也可能见到更通俗的说法：repossession（收回/收缴，尤其用于担保物）或 claim and delivery（某些州对该程序的称呼）。

summary.en: “Replevined” means someone recovered personal property through a legal action (replevin).
summary.zh: “replevined”指通过返还动产之诉等法律程序取回被不当扣留的动产。

definition.en: (Law) Took back personal property by using a legal action called replevin (often after it was wrongly taken or held).
definition.zh: （法律）通过“返还动产之诉（replevin）”这种法律程序取回动产（通常是被他人不当扣留或拿走的物品）。

examples.en: After proving the equipment was theirs, the company replevined the machines from the warehouse.
examples.zh: 在证明设备归他们所有后，公司通过返还动产之诉从仓库取回了机器。

examples.en: The bank replevined the car when the borrower stopped making payments.
examples.zh: 借款人停止还款后，银行通过法律程序取回了汽车。

extraExplanation: “replevined”是动词“replevin”的过去式/过去分词，属于较正式的法律用语，常见于合同、债务、租赁、担保等纠纷语境。
replevin强调“先把被扣留的动产取回（或请求法院命令返还）”，与一般的“recover/get back”相比，更突出“通过法院程序”。
相关概念可类比：若争的是“不动产/土地”，通常不会用replevin；replevin主要处理可移动的个人财产（personal property/chattel）。

summary.en: “Replevin” is a legal action to get personal property back; “replevy” means to recover it through that process.
summary.zh: “replevin”指通过法律程序取回被不当扣押/占有的动产；“replevy”指进行这种取回。

definition.en: (Likely intended) the legal action of getting personal property back while a court case is happening; the return of goods wrongfully taken or kept.
definition.zh: （可能是想写）“返还动产之诉/返还占有请求”——在诉讼进行中，通过法律程序取回被错误扣押或占有的动产。

examples.en: The company filed for replevin to recover the equipment that was being held by a former contractor.
examples.zh: 公司提起返还动产之诉，要求取回被前承包商扣着的设备。

examples.en: She sought replevin after her belongings were wrongfully kept by the landlord.
examples.zh: 房东不当扣留她的物品后，她申请通过法律程序要求返还。

definition.en: (Likely intended) to recover personal property through a legal process, especially before the final judgment.
definition.zh: （可能是想写）通过法律程序取回动产，尤指在最终判决前先行取回。

examples.en: The plaintiff tried to replevy the stolen goods from the pawn shop.
examples.zh: 原告试图通过法律程序从当铺取回被盗物品。

examples.en: In some cases, you can replevy the property if you post a bond.
examples.zh: 在某些情况下，如果你提供担保金，可以先行取回该财产。

extraExplanation: “replevining”不是常见标准拼写。你可能想写的是：名词 **replevin**（法律术语），或动词 **replevy** 的进行式 **replevying**。
这是英美法系里的民事救济之一，通常针对“可移动财产/动产”（personal property），例如设备、货物、车辆等；不用于土地或房屋等不动产。
词源上来自古法语与拉丁语，核心含义与“把东西再拿回来（re- + 取回）”有关，但现代英语里基本只在法律语境出现。

summary.en: Replevin is a legal process to recover personal property that is being wrongfully held.
summary.zh: Replevin 指通过法律程序取回被他人非法扣押或占有的动产。

definition.en: (Law) A legal action to get back personal property (goods) that was taken or held wrongfully, often before the final court decision.
definition.zh: （法律）返还动产之诉：一种法律程序，用来取回被他人非法扣押或占有的动产（物品），常可在法院最终判决前先行取回。

examples.en: The lender filed a replevin to recover the equipment after the borrower stopped paying.
examples.zh: 借款人停止付款后，出借方提起返还动产之诉以取回设备。

examples.en: In some states, replevin lets a person request the return of their property while the case is still ongoing.
examples.zh: 在一些州，返还动产之诉允许当事人在案件审理期间就申请先把财物取回。

definition.en: (Less common) The act of taking back goods through the replevin process; the recovery of property by court order.
definition.zh: （较少见）通过返还动产程序取回物品的行为；依法院命令追回财物。

examples.en: The replevin of the vehicle happened after the judge signed the order.
examples.zh: 法官签署命令后，车辆被依法取回。

extraExplanation: “replevin”是法律英语里比较常见但日常英语里不常用的词，多出现在合同纠纷、借贷/担保、租赁、或物品被错误扣押的情境。
你输入的“replevins”是复数形式，表示多个返还动产案件/程序，或多个取回行为。

summary.en: A legal adjective meaning property can be recovered/returned through replevin.
summary.zh: 法律用语：指财物可通过返还原物之诉等程序取回、返还。

definition.en: (Law) Able to be returned to someone after it has been taken or seized—especially property that can be recovered through a legal action called replevin.
definition.zh: （法律）可被返还的；（尤指）可通过“返还原物之诉（replevin）”从扣押或夺取中取回的财物。

examples.en: In some cases, goods held by the sheriff are replevisable if the owner posts a bond.
examples.zh: 在某些情况下，如果物主提供保证金，被治安官扣押的货物是可返还的（replevisable）。

examples.en: The court decided the equipment was replevisable because it was wrongfully taken.
examples.zh: 法院认定该设备可被返还，因为它被不当夺取。

extraExplanation: “replevisable”主要出现在英美法语境中，和动词/名词“replevin”相关。replevin 指一种用来追回特定动产（不是要金钱赔偿为主）的诉讼程序，常见于财物被不当扣押、占有或拿走时。
这个词很少用于日常英语，更常见于法院文书、法律教材或判例摘要。学习时可把它理解为“能用法律程序把东西要回来（可返还）”。

summary.en: Replevisor is a rare legal term meaning the person who brings a replevin case to recover wrongly held personal property.
summary.zh: Replevisor 是罕见的法律用语，指提起返还动产诉讼（replevin）以取回被不当占有动产的人。

definition.en: (Law, rare/archaic) A person who brings a replevin action—someone who asks a court to recover personal property that is being wrongfully held by another person.
definition.zh: （法律用语，少见/古旧）提起“返还动产诉讼（replevin）”的人；也就是向法院请求取回被他人不当占有的动产的一方。

examples.en: In older legal writing, the replevisor sought the return of the seized goods.
examples.zh: 在较早的法律写作中，replevisor 指请求返还被扣押货物的一方。

examples.en: If you see “replevisor” in a document, it usually refers to the party trying to get property back through replevin.
examples.zh: 如果你在文件里看到“replevisor”，通常指通过返还动产诉讼想把财物取回的那一方。

extraExplanation: 这个词在现代英语里非常罕见，多见于旧式法律文本或词典。现代更常用的相关词是 replevin（返还动产诉讼）以及更直白的说法：the plaintiff in a replevin action（返还动产诉讼中的原告）。
replevin 通常用于“取回具体动产”（如被扣押的货物、被占有的物品），区别于处理不动产的纠纷。

summary.en: Replevy means to recover seized or withheld property through a legal process, often by posting a bond.
summary.zh: Replevy 指通过法律程序（常需提供担保）取回被扣押或被占有的财物。

definition.en: (Law) to get back property that has been taken or held (often by a court officer), especially by posting a bond or following a legal process while a case continues.
definition.zh: （法律）通过提供担保或走法律程序，在案件未了结时取回被扣押、被没收或被他人占有的财物。

examples.en: The court allowed the tenant to replevy the furniture after she posted a bond.
examples.zh: 法院允许房客在缴纳担保金后取回那套家具。

examples.en: He tried to replevy the seized equipment, arguing it was not connected to the investigation.
examples.zh: 他试图取回被扣押的设备，称这些设备与调查无关。

extraExplanation: “replevy”多见于美国法律语境，和名词“replevin（取回原物之诉）”密切相关：replevin是通过诉讼要求返还特定动产（如车辆、机器、家具），而replevy强调“把东西先取回/赎回”这一动作，常伴随提供bond（担保金）。
日常英语中很少用到该词；更常见的表达是“recover the property”或“get the property back”，但在法律文件里会用“replevy”来精确指代这种程序性取回。

summary.en: Replevying means legally getting property back after it has been seized or wrongfully held, often by posting a bond.
summary.zh: replevying 指通过法律程序在财物被扣押或被不当占有后将其取回，常涉及提供保证金。

definition.en: (legal) The act of getting property back after it was taken or held (for example, seized by a court), usually by starting a replevin action and/or posting a bond.
definition.zh: （法律）指在财物被扣押、占有或依法扣留后，通过提起返还动产之诉（replevin）和/或提供保证金等方式，将财物取回的行为。

examples.en: The company is replevying the equipment that was seized during the dispute.
examples.zh: 公司正在取回在纠纷中被扣押的设备。

examples.en: After replevying the goods, the owner still had to appear in court to resolve the claim.
examples.zh: 取回货物后，物主仍需出庭解决相关主张。

extraExplanation: “replevying”是动词“replevy”的现在分词/动名词形式，属于偏正式的法律用语，多见于英美普通法语境。
它通常与“replevin（返还动产之诉）”相关：当某人主张自己对动产（如设备、车辆、货物）有更优先的占有权时，可以请求法院命令返还，并常要求提供bond（保证金）以防争议期间的风险。
在日常英语里很少用；一般会用更普通的说法，如“getting the property back / recovering the goods（取回/追回财物）”。

summary.en: Reprisal means retaliation—an action taken to get back at someone for harm they caused.
summary.zh: Reprisal 指“报复/反击”，即因对方先造成伤害而采取的回击行动。

definition.en: (likely intended: “reprisal”) an act of retaliation—doing something harmful back to someone because they harmed you first.
definition.zh: （你可能想写的是 reprisal）报复；反击——因对方先造成伤害而采取的回击行为。

examples.en: The company feared a reprisal after it fired the workers.
examples.zh: 公司担心解雇工人后会遭到报复。

examples.en: The journalist received threats of reprisal for telling the truth.
examples.zh: 这名记者因揭露真相而收到报复威胁。

definition.en: a retaliatory action by a government, group, or army (often in political or military situations).
definition.zh: （常用于政治或军事语境）报复行动；报复性措施。

examples.en: The attack was seen as a reprisal for earlier violence.
examples.zh: 这次袭击被视为对先前暴力事件的报复。

examples.en: They warned that any strike would bring swift reprisals.
examples.zh: 他们警告说，任何打击都会招致迅速的报复。

extraExplanation: “replial” 不是常见英文单词，最接近、也最常被误拼的是 “reprisal”。拼写提示：re- + pr- + -isal（中间是 “pri”，不是 “pli”）。
常见搭配：fear reprisal（担心报复）、in reprisal for…（作为对……的报复）、reprisal attacks（报复性袭击）。

summary.en: Repliant (rare) means compliant or yielding; it can also mean flexible or bending back.
summary.zh: repliant（较罕见）指“顺从的、愿意让步的”，也可指“柔韧的、可弯曲的”。

definition.en: (rare, literary) Willing to yield or obey; compliant; easily influenced.
definition.zh: （罕见/文学用语）顺从的；愿意让步的；容易受影响的。

examples.en: The manager preferred a repliant assistant who wouldn’t question decisions.
examples.zh: 经理更喜欢一个顺从的助理，不会质疑决定。

examples.en: In the novel, she appears gentle and repliant, though she hides strong opinions.
examples.zh: 在小说里，她看起来温柔顺从，但其实隐藏着强烈的观点。

definition.en: Bending back or flexible; pliant.
definition.zh: 可弯曲的；柔韧的；易弯折的。

examples.en: The repliant branch bent under the weight of the snow and sprang back later.
examples.zh: 柔韧的树枝在积雪重压下弯下去，后来又弹了回来。

extraExplanation: “repliant”比较少见，多出现在文学描写中；日常英语里更常用的词是“compliant / obedient / yielding”来表达“顺从”。
词根上与“pliant（柔顺的、柔韧的）”意义非常接近，可以把它理解为“再次弯曲/容易弯”的感觉，因此既可形容人“顺从”，也可形容物体“柔韧”。

summary.en: Replica means an exact copy of something; it can be a museum-style reproduction or an imitation product.
summary.zh: Replica 指“与原物很像的复制品/仿制品”；可用于博物馆等中性语境，也可指商品仿品。

definition.en: an exact copy of an object, especially one made to look like the original (often for display, study, or when the original is rare or valuable)
definition.zh: 复制品；仿制品（通常指尽量与原物一致，用于展示、研究或替代珍贵/稀有真品）

examples.en: The museum displayed a replica of an ancient Greek statue so visitors could see the details up close.
examples.zh: 博物馆展示了一尊古希腊雕像的复制品，让游客能近距离看到细节。

examples.en: Because the original is too fragile, researchers work with a replica.
examples.zh: 因为原件太脆弱，研究人员使用复制品来进行研究。

definition.en: a product made to imitate a famous or expensive item, often in fashion or luxury goods
definition.zh: 仿品；高仿（常指模仿名牌或昂贵商品的外观与风格）

examples.en: She bought a replica bag that looks similar to the designer one.
examples.zh: 她买了一个看起来很像名牌的仿品包。

examples.en: Some stores sell replicas, but they may be illegal if they copy a brand logo.
examples.zh: 有些店卖仿品，但如果复制品牌标志，可能是违法的。

extraExplanation: “replica”在博物馆语境里通常较中性，强调“用于展示/研究的精确复制”；在商品语境里则可能带有“仿冒”的含义，是否违法取决于是否涉及商标、版权等。
常见搭配：a replica of + 名词（a replica of the ship / the painting）；make/create/build a replica（制作复制品）。

summary.en: Replicability means a result can be repeated with similar outcomes when the same method is used.
summary.zh: Replicability 指使用相同方法重复时仍能得到相同或相近结果的“可重复性”。

definition.en: the ability of a study, test, or result to be repeated with the same (or very similar) outcome, especially when others follow the same methods
definition.zh: （尤指他人按同样方法操作时）研究、测试或结果能够被重复并得到相同或相近结论的特性；可重复性

examples.en: The replicability of the experiment depends on clear instructions and accurate measurements.
examples.zh: 实验的可重复性取决于清晰的操作说明和准确的测量。

examples.en: Scientists are working to improve replicability by sharing data and methods.
examples.zh: 科学家正通过共享数据和方法来提高可重复性。

extraExplanation: 在科研语境里，replicability 常与 reproducibility 一起出现，但不同领域用法不完全一致：常见的一种区分是 replicability 指“用相同方法重复实验得到相同结果”，reproducibility 指“用不同数据/不同方法也能得到一致结论”。实际写作中应以期刊或学科的定义为准。
replicability 在“心理学、医学、计算机科学（机器学习）”等领域讨论较多，常与“开放数据（open data）、开放方法（open methods）、预注册（preregistration）”等实践相关。

summary.en: Replicable means something can be repeated or reproduced with the same results.
summary.zh: Replicable 指某事物可以被重复或复现，并得到相同结果。

definition.en: Able to be repeated or copied with the same results, especially in experiments, research, or processes.
definition.zh: 可重复的；可复制的（尤指实验、研究或流程中能得到相同结果）。

examples.en: The study’s results are replicable if other labs can get the same outcome.
examples.zh: 如果其他实验室也能得到同样的结果，这项研究的结果就是可重复的。

examples.en: We need a replicable method, not a one-time success.
examples.zh: 我们需要一种可重复的方法，而不是一次性的成功。

extraExplanation: “replicable”常用于科学与数据领域，强调别人按照同样步骤也能复现同样结果。日常英语里也能用，但更常见的同义表达是“repeatable”。
区别小提示：replicable 更偏“别人也能复制/复现”；repeatable 更偏“同一个人多次做也能重复”。不过在很多语境中二者会混用。

summary.en: A replicant is usually a sci‑fi artificial human made to look and behave like a real person.
summary.zh: replicant 通常指科幻作品中的“仿生人/人造人”，被制造得外表与行为都像真人。

definition.en: A person or creature (often in science fiction) that is made to look and act like a human, usually through advanced technology such as bioengineering; an artificial human.
definition.zh: （常见于科幻）通过先进技术（如生物工程）制造出来、外表和行为像人类的“仿生人/人造人”。

examples.en: In the movie, the replicant tries to live like a normal human.
examples.zh: 在电影里，这个仿生人试图像普通人一样生活。

examples.en: The story asks whether a replicant deserves the same rights as people.
examples.zh: 这个故事探讨仿生人是否应当享有与人类相同的权利。

definition.en: Something that is an almost exact copy of another thing; a replica (less common in everyday English).
definition.zh: 与某物几乎一模一样的复制品；仿制品（较少用于日常英语）。

examples.en: The museum displayed a replicant of the ancient statue for visitors to touch.
examples.zh: 博物馆展示了那尊古代雕像的复制品，让游客可以触摸。

extraExplanation: “replicant”最出名的出处是科幻电影《Blade Runner》（《银翼杀手》）及其原作相关语境，用来指“看起来像人类的生物工程人造人”。因此这个词带有强烈的科幻、伦理与身份认同讨论色彩。
词源上与“replica（复制品）”同源，来自“replicate（复制、再现）”。在非科幻语境里，人们更常说“replica / copy / duplicate”，较少用“replicant”。

summary.en: Replicare is mainly a Latin/Italian verb meaning “to fold back,” and by extension “to repeat” or “to reply,” not a common English word.
summary.zh: Replicare 主要是拉丁语/意大利语动词，意为“折回”，引申为“重复”或“回应”，并非英语常用词。

definition.en: a Latin (and also Italian) verb meaning “to fold back,” and by extension “to repeat” or “to reply”; it is not a standard modern English word.
definition.zh: 拉丁语（也可见于意大利语）的动词，原义为“折回、折叠回来”，引申为“重复”或“回应”；它不是现代英语中的常用词。

examples.en: In a Latin class, you might see replicare used to mean “to reply.”
examples.zh: 在拉丁语课堂里，你可能会看到 replicare 表示“回应/回答”。

examples.en: If you mean the English verb, the common word is replicate: “Scientists replicate the experiment.”
examples.zh: 如果你想表达英语动词，常用词是 replicate：“科学家重复（复现）这个实验。”

extraExplanation: replicare 常被认为与英语 replicate（复制/复现/重复）同源：拉丁语里 re- 有“再次、回”的意思，plicare 有“折叠”的意思；“折回/再折一次”就很自然引申到“再做一次（重复）”，以及在对话里“回折/回去”→“回话（回应）”。
在现代英语写作中几乎不用 replicare；学术或日常英语里通常用 replicate（复现/复制）、repeat（重复）、reply/respond（回应）。

summary.en: “Replicas” means exact or very close copies of an original object, often used for display, safety, or collecting.
summary.zh: “replicas”指原物的（高度相似的）复制品/仿制品，常用于展览、安全替代或收藏。

definition.en: Exact copies of something (often made to look like the original, sometimes at a smaller size).
definition.zh: （常指外观上）与原物非常相像的复制品、仿制品（有时是缩小版）。

examples.en: The museum displays replicas of ancient sculptures so visitors can see the details up close.
examples.zh: 博物馆展出了古代雕塑的复制品，让游客能近距离看到细节。

examples.en: He bought replicas of famous cars to collect at home.
examples.zh: 他买了著名汽车的模型/仿制品在家收藏。

definition.en: Copies made to stand in for the original in filming, exhibitions, or restoration work.
definition.zh: （用于拍摄、展览或修复等场景中代替真品的）替代复制品。

examples.en: For safety, the movie used replicas of the jewelry in most scenes.
examples.zh: 为安全起见，电影在大多数镜头中使用了珠宝的替代复制品。

examples.en: The temple’s replicas were installed while the originals were being repaired.
examples.zh: 原件维修期间，寺庙安装了替代复制品。

extraExplanation: “replicas”是名词复数，单数是“replica”。日常英语里常见搭配有：replica watch（仿表/高仿表）、replica handbag（仿包）、replica statue（复制雕像）。
在文化与法律语境中，使用“replica/replicas”通常暗示“外观相似但不是原件”；若涉及假货交易，英语也会用“counterfeit”（假冒的）来强调违法性。

summary.en: Replicate means to copy something exactly or to reproduce the same results; in biology it often means to multiply by copying itself.
summary.zh: Replicate 指精确复制或复现同样结果；在生物学中常指（病毒/细胞等）通过自我复制而增殖。

definition.en: To make an exact copy of something; to reproduce the same result, appearance, or behavior.
definition.zh: 精确复制；再现（同样的结果、外观或行为）。

examples.en: Researchers tried to replicate the experiment in another lab.
examples.zh: 研究人员尝试在另一家实验室复现实验。

examples.en: This fabric is designed to replicate the look of real leather.
examples.zh: 这种面料被设计用来仿真真皮的外观。

examples.en: I can’t replicate her accent perfectly.
examples.zh: 我没法把她的口音完美复制出来。

definition.en: To repeat something multiple times; to make many copies.
definition.zh: 重复多次；制作许多份副本。

examples.en: The virus replicates quickly inside the body.
examples.zh: 这种病毒会在体内快速复制。

examples.en: They replicated the design across all their stores.
examples.zh: 他们把这个设计复制应用到所有门店。

extraExplanation: 在科学语境里，replicate 强调“可重复、可验证”：同样的方法在不同时间/地点也应得到相近结果。常见搭配：replicate an experiment / replicate results。
在生物学里常用 replicate 表示“（细胞/病毒/DNA）复制增殖”，有时也写作 replicate itself。
