examples.zh: 睡了个好觉后，她感觉重新充满力量，准备学习。

examples.en: The team took a short break and came back repowered.
examples.zh: 团队休息了一会儿，回来时精神更足了。

definition.en: refitted with a new engine, motor, or power system (especially for vehicles, ships, or power plants)
definition.zh: （尤指车辆、船只或电站）更换了新的发动机/电机/动力系统；完成“动力系统升级”

examples.en: The old bus was repowered with a cleaner engine to reduce pollution.
examples.zh: 这辆旧公交车更换了更清洁的发动机，以减少污染。

examples.en: Several wind turbines were repowered to produce more electricity.
examples.zh: 一些风力发电机进行了“增容改造/更换机组”，以发更多电。

examples.en: The ship was repowered and now uses less fuel.
examples.zh: 这艘船更换了动力系统，现在更省油。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “repower”: to give something a new source of power or to restore its power
definition.zh: “repower”的过去式/过去分词：给某物更换动力来源或恢复其动力

examples.en: They repowered the generator after years of heavy use.
examples.zh: 多年高强度使用后，他们为发电机进行了动力系统更新。

examples.en: The company repowered its operations with new software tools.
examples.zh: 公司用新的软件工具让运营“重新提速”。

extraExplanation: “repower”在能源与工程领域很常见：例如对风电机组进行repowering，通常指更换叶片、发电机或控制系统，让同一地点在不新增太多基础设施的情况下发更多电。日常表达中也会借用作比喻，表示“充电/满血复活”。

summary.en: Repowering means upgrading or replacing an engine or power system—often used for vehicles, machines, and energy sites like wind farms—to improve power, efficiency, or output.
summary.zh: Repowering 指更换或升级发动机/动力系统（也常用于风电等能源场址的更新改造），以提升动力、效率或发电输出。

definition.en: the process of replacing or upgrading a machine’s engine, motor, or power source to restore or increase its power and efficiency
definition.zh: （给机器）更换或升级发动机/电机/动力系统的过程，以恢复或提升动力与效率

examples.en: The company is repowering its older trucks with cleaner, more efficient engines.
examples.zh: 这家公司正在为旧卡车进行动力系统升级，更换更清洁、更高效的发动机。

examples.en: After repowering, the boat used less fuel and had better acceleration.
examples.zh: 动力系统更换后，这艘船更省油、加速也更好。

definition.en: (energy industry) upgrading an existing power plant or renewable-energy site by replacing major equipment to increase output or extend its life
definition.zh: （能源行业）通过更换关键设备来升级现有电站或可再生能源场址，以提高发电量或延长寿命

examples.en: Wind-farm repowering can boost electricity production without building a new site.
examples.zh: 风电场“增容改造/更新”可以在不新建场址的情况下提升发电量。

examples.en: The solar project plans repowering by installing higher-efficiency panels and inverters.
examples.zh: 该光伏项目计划通过安装更高效率的组件和逆变器来进行升级改造。

definition.en: replacing or upgrading the power system of (a vehicle, machine, or site)
definition.zh: 为（车辆、机器或场址）更换或升级动力系统

examples.en: They are repowering the ferry to meet stricter emissions rules.
examples.zh: 他们正在给渡轮更换/升级动力系统，以满足更严格的排放规定。

examples.en: The plant is repowering its turbines to improve reliability.
examples.zh: 该电厂正在更新改造涡轮机以提高可靠性。

extraExplanation: “Repowering”常见于工程与能源新闻。对风电场来说，往往指把旧风机换成更大、更高效的新机组（有时数量更少但总发电更高）；中文常译为“增容改造、更新改造、以旧换新”。
在船舶/车辆领域，repowering通常指“换发动机/换动力系统”，有时也包含从燃油改为电动或混动（如diesel-to-electric conversion）。
搭配常见：repowering project（改造项目）, repowering program（改造计划）, repowering older fleets（升级老旧车队）, wind-farm repowering（风电场改造）。

summary.en: “Repowers” means replaces an engine/power source with a new one, or restores power again.
summary.zh: “repowers”指更换新的发动机/动力系统，或使恢复供电、重新通电。

definition.en: to replace an engine or power source with a new one (often stronger or more efficient)
definition.zh: （为机器/车辆等）更换新的发动机或动力系统（通常更强或更省能）

examples.en: The company repowers its older boats with quieter engines.
examples.zh: 这家公司给旧船更换更安静的发动机。

examples.en: He repowers the lawn mower instead of buying a new one.
examples.zh: 他给割草机更换动力系统，而不是买新的。

definition.en: to restore power to something again; to power up again
definition.zh: （使）恢复供电/重新通电；再次启动供电

examples.en: After the storm, crews repower the neighborhood block by block.
examples.zh: 暴风雨后，抢修人员一条街一条街地恢复供电。

examples.en: Restart the router to repower the system.
examples.zh: 重启路由器，让系统重新通电运行。

extraExplanation: “repowers”通常是动词第三人称单数形式（he/she/it repowers）。常见于工程与能源语境：例如“repowering a plant”（对电厂进行动力系统升级），指保留原有设施但更换关键动力/发电设备，以提升效率、降低排放或延长寿命。

summary.en: “Repp” is usually a misspelling of “rep,” meaning a representative, an exercise repetition, or (less commonly) a reputation.
summary.zh: “repp”通常是“rep”的误拼，常指代表/销售代表、健身中的一次重复动作（次数），或（较少见）名声。

definition.en: (informal) Short for “representative,” especially a sales representative or a member of a group who speaks/acts for others.
definition.zh: （非正式）“representative”的缩写，常指销售代表，或代表某个群体发言/办事的人。

examples.en: Ask a customer service rep for help with your order.
examples.zh: 请找客服代表帮你处理订单。

examples.en: Our class rep will talk to the teacher about the schedule.
examples.zh: 我们班的代表会和老师沟通课程安排。

definition.en: (fitness) Short for “repetition,” meaning one complete movement of an exercise.
definition.zh: （健身）“repetition”的缩写，指一次完整的动作（一次重复）。

examples.en: Do 10 reps of push-ups.
examples.zh: 做10次俯卧撑。

examples.en: I increased my reps but kept the weight the same.
examples.zh: 我增加了次数，但重量不变。

definition.en: (informal) Short for “reputation.”
definition.zh: （非正式）“reputation”的缩写，指名声、口碑。

examples.en: That restaurant has a great rep in town.
examples.zh: 那家餐厅在城里口碑很好。

extraExplanation: “repp”本身不是常见英语单词；很多情况下是把“rep”多打了一个字母，或是人名/姓氏（Repp）。
在口语和短信里，“rep”最常见的两个意思是：①代表/销售代表；②健身里的“次数”。如果你是在健身语境看到“repp/reps”，通常指训练次数。

summary.en: “Repped” usually means “represented/promoted” (informal), or “did repetitions” in exercise.
summary.zh: “repped”通常指口语的“代表/宣传”，也可指健身里“做了若干次（次数）”。

definition.en: (Informal) Past tense of “rep”: to represent, speak for, or promote someone/something (often a brand, team, or community).
definition.zh: （非正式）“rep”的过去式：代表、为……代言/站台，或宣传（常指品牌、球队、社群）。

examples.en: She repped her school at the debate tournament.
examples.zh: 她在辩论赛上代表了自己的学校。

examples.en: He repped the new sneakers all weekend.
examples.zh: 他整个周末都在“带货/宣传”那双新球鞋。

definition.en: Past tense of “rep” (short for “repetition”): did a set number of repetitions in exercise.
definition.zh: “rep”（repetition 的缩写）的过去式：在训练中做了若干次重复动作（次数）。

examples.en: I repped 10 push-ups, then took a break.
examples.zh: 我做了10次俯卧撑，然后休息了一下。

examples.en: She repped 8 on the bench press.
examples.zh: 她卧推做了8次。

extraExplanation: “repped” 很口语，常见于社交媒体、街头文化与运动语境：rep a brand（为品牌代言/穿戴展示）、rep your city（代表自己的城市/身份）。
在健身语境里，rep=一次重复动作；“repped 8”通常省略了重量或动作名称，需要结合上下文理解。

summary.en: “Reps” usually means exercise repetitions; it can also mean representatives.
summary.zh: “reps”通常指健身中的“次数/重复”；也可指“代表/业务代表”。

definition.en: (informal) Short for “repetitions”: the number of times you do an exercise movement.
definition.zh: （非正式）“repetitions”的简称：做某个动作的重复次数（健身/训练常用）。

examples.en: Do 10 reps of squats, then rest for one minute.
examples.zh: 做10次深蹲，然后休息一分钟。

examples.en: I can do more reps with lighter weights.
examples.zh: 用更轻的重量我能做更多次。

definition.en: Plural of “rep” meaning a representative (someone who speaks or acts for a person/company/group).
definition.zh: “rep”的复数，指代表、业务代表（代表个人/公司/团体的人）。

examples.en: Our sales reps will contact you tomorrow.
examples.zh: 我们的销售代表明天会联系你。

examples.en: The student reps raised concerns about the schedule.
examples.zh: 学生代表提出了对课程表的担忧。

extraExplanation: 你输入的 **repps** 常见于把 **reps**（/rɛps/）多打了一个 p。英语里健身语境几乎都写 **reps**。
另外，英语里确实有 **repp**（一种有凸纹的织物）的词，但比较少见；其复数才会是 **repps**。如果你指的是布料/领带面料，我也可以给你那个词条。

summary.en: “Repr” is a common abbreviation for “representation,” especially in computing, meaning an object’s developer-oriented text form.
summary.zh: “repr”常作“representation（表示/表征）”的缩写，尤其在编程中指对象面向开发者的文本表示形式。

definition.en: (computing) Short for “representation”; the developer-friendly text form of an object, often used for debugging (e.g., Python’s repr()).
definition.zh: （计算机）“representation（表示/表征）”的缩写；指对象面向开发者的文本表示形式，常用于调试（如 Python 的 repr()）。

examples.en: In Python, repr(x) returns a string that shows x in a developer-friendly way.
examples.zh: 在 Python 里，repr(x) 会返回一个字符串，用更方便开发者理解的方式展示 x。

examples.en: The log prints the object’s repr so we can debug the problem quickly.
examples.zh: 日志会打印对象的 repr，这样我们能更快定位问题。

definition.en: (informal, online) To give or show representation for a group; to represent (often used in fandom or social discussions).
definition.zh: （非正式/网络用语）为某个群体提供/展示“代表性”；代表（常见于粉丝文化或社会议题讨论）。

examples.en: This character helps repr people who rarely see themselves on screen.
examples.zh: 这个角色能 repr 那些很少在屏幕上看到自己的人。

extraExplanation: 在编程语境里，repr 通常和 str 对比：str 更偏向“给用户看”的自然可读文本；repr 更偏向“给开发者看”的精确表示（理想情况下能用于重建对象，或至少包含关键细节）。

summary.en: “repr” is an abbreviation used mainly in technical contexts, meaning “representation,” and in programming it often refers to Python’s repr() output.
summary.zh: “repr”主要用于技术语境的缩写，常指“表示/表征（representation）”；在编程中常指 Python 的 repr() 输出。

definition.en: (abbr.) short for “representation,” meaning a depiction or way of showing something (common in tech and academic writing).
definition.zh: （缩写）“representation”的简写，指“表示、呈现、表征”的方式（常见于技术或学术语境）。

examples.en: In machine learning, a good repr of the data can improve accuracy.
examples.zh: 在机器学习中，好的数据表示（repr）能提高准确率。

examples.en: The diagram is a simplified repr of the system.
examples.zh: 这张图是对系统的简化表示（repr）。

definition.en: (programming) short for “representation string,” especially the Python function repr() that returns an unambiguous text form of an object.
definition.zh: （编程）“表示字符串”的简称，尤指 Python 中的 repr() 函数，用来返回对象清晰且尽量不含歧义的文本形式。

examples.en: Use repr(x) to see the exact string, including escape characters.
examples.zh: 用 repr(x) 可以看到精确字符串，包括转义字符。

examples.en: The error log printed the object's repr for debugging.
examples.zh: 错误日志打印了对象的 repr 以便调试。

extraExplanation: 在英语里更常见的是写作“rep.”（表示 representation）或直接写“representation”。“repr”多见于代码、论文笔记、变量名、日志输出等偏技术的场景。
Python 里常对比 repr() 与 str()：repr() 更偏“给开发者看的、尽量精确”；str() 更偏“给用户看的、可读性更强”。

summary.en: “Repractice” means to practice something again, usually to improve it.
summary.zh: “Repractice”表示把某件事再练一次，通常为了改进。

definition.en: to practice something again (often to improve or correct it)
definition.zh: 再次练习（通常为了改进或纠正）

examples.en: After getting feedback, I repracticed the presentation until it felt natural.
examples.zh: 收到反馈后，我把演讲又练了几遍，直到感觉很自然。

examples.en: Let’s repractice the first two lines more slowly.
examples.zh: 我们把前两句再慢一点练一遍。

extraExplanation: “repractice”由前缀 re-（再次）+ practice（练习）构成，意思直观，但在日常英语里不算特别常见。很多时候母语者会更常用 “practice again / rehearse again / go over it again”。在教学、训练或排练语境中使用 “repractice” 会更自然。

summary.en: “Repracticed” means practiced or rehearsed again.
summary.zh: “repracticed”表示“再次练习/重新排练”。

definition.en: practiced again; rehearsed again to improve skill, accuracy, or confidence
definition.zh: 再次练习；重新排练（为了提升技能、准确度或信心）

examples.en: After a week off, she repracticed the song before the concert.
examples.zh: 休息了一周后，她在音乐会前又把那首歌重新练习了一遍。

examples.en: We repracticed the emergency drill to make sure everyone remembered their roles.
examples.zh: 我们又重新演练了应急演习，确保每个人都记得自己的职责。

examples.en: He repracticed his presentation out loud until it felt natural.
examples.zh: 他把演讲稿大声重新练了好几遍，直到听起来自然为止。

extraExplanation: “repracticed”是动词“repractice”的过去式/过去分词，但在现代英语里相对少见。日常更常用的表达是“practiced again / rehearsed again / went over it again”。如果是在音乐、舞蹈、戏剧等语境里，“rehearse”更地道；在技能训练（如运动、打字、数学题）里，“practice again”更常见。

summary.en: “Repracticing” means practicing something again to improve or correct mistakes.
summary.zh: “repracticing”表示“再练一次/重新练习”，用于提升或纠错。

definition.en: practicing something again in order to improve, remember, or fix mistakes
definition.zh: 再次练习某事，以提升、记住或纠正错误

examples.en: I’m repracticing the piano piece because I keep missing the rhythm in the middle.
examples.zh: 我在重新练习那首钢琴曲，因为我总是在中间的节奏上出错。

examples.en: After the feedback, the team is repracticing the presentation to sound more confident.
examples.zh: 收到反馈后，团队在重新演练这次展示，让表达更有自信。

extraExplanation: “repracticing”来自“re-（再一次）+ practice（练习）”。它在日常英语里不算常见，更自然的说法常是“practice again / rehearse again / go over it again”。不过在训练、音乐、运动或教学语境中，用“repractice”也能被理解。
注意拼写：英式英语常写作“practise（动词）/ practice（名词）”，美式英语一般动词和名词都写“practice”。因此美式里常见“repracticing”，英式语境也可能见到“repractising”。

summary.en: *Repraesentare* is a Latin verb meaning “to represent/depict” and sometimes “to make present or pay/deliver immediately.”
summary.zh: *Repraesentare* 是拉丁语动词，主要义为“表示/再现/描绘”，也可指“使立刻出现、立即交付或兑现”。

definition.en: (Latin) to represent; to present again in a visible form; to portray or depict.
definition.zh: （拉丁语）表示；再现；描绘、刻画（把某事以可见的形式呈现出来）。

examples.en: In Latin texts, *repraesentare* can mean “to bring something before the eyes,” i.e., to depict it clearly.
examples.zh: 在拉丁文献中，*repraesentare* 可表示“把某物带到眼前”，也就是清晰地描绘出来。

examples.en: A writer might use *repraesentare* to say that a speech “represents” the people’s wishes.
examples.zh: 作家可能用 *repraesentare* 来说一篇演讲“代表”人民的愿望。

definition.en: (Latin, extended sense) to make present immediately; to produce or deliver at once (often used of money or results).
definition.zh: （拉丁语，引申义）使……立刻到场/到手；立即交付、立即兑现（常用于金钱或结果）。

examples.en: In some contexts, *repraesentare* can imply paying a sum immediately rather than later.
examples.zh: 在某些语境中，*repraesentare* 可暗示“立即付款/立即兑现”，而不是以后再付。

extraExplanation: *repraesentare* 是英语 **represent** 的词源之一：re-（再次）+ praesentare（使……在场、呈现）。因此它既有“再现/描绘”的含义，也能引申到“让某物立刻出现或交付”。
拼写里出现的 **ae** 是拉丁语常见的二合元音写法；在进入英语及其他语言后，常简化或变化为 **e**（如 represent）。

summary.en: Repraise means to praise again.
summary.zh: repraise 意为“再次称赞、重新表扬”。

definition.en: to praise someone or something again; to express approval a second time (often after a change or new information).
definition.zh: 再次称赞；重新表扬（常指在情况变化或得到新信息后再表达肯定）。

examples.en: After reading the revised essay, the teacher repraised her clear argument.
examples.zh: 读完修改后的作文，老师再次称赞了她清晰的论证。

examples.en: The coach repraised the team for staying calm under pressure.
examples.zh: 教练再次表扬了球队在压力下保持冷静。

extraExplanation: “repraise”在现代英语里比较少见；很多时候人们会用更自然的说法，比如 “praise again / praise anew / commend again”。
注意不要和 “reappraise” 混淆：reappraise 是“重新评估（价值、情况）”，不一定带有“称赞”的意思。

summary.en: “Repraised” means “praised again,” and more rarely “appraised again” (reappraised).
summary.zh: “repraised”常指“再次称赞”；较少见时可指“重新评估/重新估价”（更常写作 reappraised）。

definition.en: past tense / past participle of “repraise”: to praise again, often after reconsidering someone or something.
definition.zh: “repraise”的过去式/过去分词：再次称赞（通常是重新考虑之后又给予肯定）。

examples.en: After hearing the full story, the coach repraised the player’s effort.
examples.zh: 听完完整情况后，教练再次称赞了那位球员的努力。

examples.en: The book was repraised by critics when it was reissued years later.
examples.zh: 这本书在多年后再版时，又一次受到评论家的称赞。

definition.en: (rare) past tense / past participle of “repraise”: to appraise again; to judge the value or quality again.
definition.zh: （罕见）“repraise”的过去式/过去分词：重新评估；再次鉴定价值或质量。

examples.en: The antiques were repraised after new documents proved their origin.
examples.zh: 在新文件证明其来源后，那些古董被重新评估了价值。

extraExplanation: “repraise”这个词本身不常见。表达“重新称赞”时更常用的是 praise again / praise anew / re-praise（加连字符也有人用）。
如果你想表达“重新评估/重新估价”，更常见、也更清晰的词是 reappraise（重新评估）或 reappraisal（重新评估）。因为 repraise 很容易让人误读成“再次称赞”。

summary.en: Repraising means praising again or reassessing (appraising) something again.
summary.zh: Repraising 指“再次称赞”，也可指“重新评估/再估价”。

definition.en: to praise someone or something again (often after reconsidering or when they are being recognized anew)
definition.zh: 再次称赞；重新赞美（常指重新考虑后或再次表彰时）

examples.en: After reading her latest book, critics began repraising her early work.
examples.zh: 读完她的新书后，评论家开始再次称赞她的早期作品。

examples.en: The coach is repraising the team for their improved teamwork.
examples.zh: 教练正在再次表扬球队更好的团队合作。

definition.en: to appraise or evaluate again; to reassess the value, quality, or importance of something
definition.zh: 重新评估；再估价；重新衡量（价值、质量或重要性）

examples.en: The museum is repraising the painting to confirm its market value.
examples.zh: 博物馆正在重新评估这幅画，以确认其市场价值。

examples.en: We’re repraising the plan after getting new information.
examples.zh: 得到新信息后，我们正在重新评估这个计划。

extraExplanation: “repraising”来自动词“repraise”的现在分词形式。它在日常英语里不算常见：表达“再次称赞”时，更常用“praise again”；表达“重新评估”时，更常用“reassess / re-evaluate / reappraise”。在艺术品、房地产等语境里，第二个意思（再估价）更贴近专业用法。

summary.en: “Repray” means to pray again or repeat a prayer; it’s rare/archaic in modern English.
summary.zh: “repray”意为“再次祈祷/重复祈祷”，在现代英语中较少见，多偏古体。

definition.en: to pray again; to repeat a prayer (rare/archaic).
definition.zh: 再祈祷；重复祈祷（较少见/古体用法）。

examples.en: She knelt to repray the same words for comfort.
examples.zh: 她跪下再次重复同样的祷词，以寻求安慰。

examples.en: In some older texts, a character may repray after a moment of doubt.
examples.zh: 在一些较早的文本中，人物在犹豫之后可能会“再次祈祷”。

extraExplanation: “repray”在现代英语中非常少见，多见于较早的文学或宗教语境；现代更常用的表达是“pray again / repeat a prayer”。
不要和常见词“repay”（偿还、回报）混淆：repay 的读音和意思都不同。

summary.en: Repreach is an archaic verb meaning “to reproach” or “to blame,” sometimes with the sense of doing so again.
summary.zh: Repreach 是古用动词，意思是“责备/指责”（相当于 reproach），有时带“再次责骂”的含义。

definition.en: (Archaic) To criticize or blame someone for something; to reproach.
definition.zh: （古用）责备；指责；责难（相当于 reproach）。

examples.en: He did not repreach her for the mistake, knowing it was an accident.
examples.zh: 他没有因为这个错误责备她，因为他知道那是个意外。

examples.en: The letter seemed to repreach him for his silence.
examples.zh: 那封信似乎在责怪他一直沉默不语。

definition.en: (Rare) To scold or rebuke again; to reproach repeatedly.
definition.zh: （少见）再次责骂；反复指责。

examples.en: She would not repreach him twice; she simply walked away.
examples.zh: 她不会再责骂他第二次；她只是转身离开。

extraExplanation: “repreach”在现代英语里非常少见，常被视为古英语/早期现代英语用法；日常写作与口语通常用“reproach / blame / criticize / accuse”。
词形上可理解为 re-（再、重新）+ preach（讲道、训诫）的一种历史拼写/构词方式，因此语感上带有“训斥、责难”的味道。

summary.en: Reprecipitate means “to precipitate again,” especially in chemistry when a dissolved substance forms a solid again.
summary.zh: Reprecipitate 指“再次沉淀”，多用于化学语境，表示溶解物再次形成固体。

definition.en: To precipitate again; to cause a dissolved substance to form a solid again (often by changing temperature, concentration, or adding another chemical).
definition.zh: （使）再次沉淀；使溶解的物质再次形成固体（常通过改变温度、浓度或加入其他化学物质）。

examples.en: After heating the solution, the chemist cooled it to reprecipitate the crystals.
examples.zh: 加热溶液后，化学家将其冷却，使晶体再次沉淀出来。

examples.en: If the pH changes, some ions can reprecipitate as a solid.
examples.zh: 如果 pH 改变，一些离子可能会以固体形式再次沉淀。

definition.en: To form a precipitate again; to separate out of a solution again as a solid.
definition.zh: 再次沉淀；从溶液中再次以固体形式析出。

examples.en: When the mixture stood overnight, the dissolved material began to reprecipitate.
examples.zh: 当混合物静置一夜后，已溶解的物质开始再次沉淀。

extraExplanation: 这是一个偏科学/化学领域的词：prefix “re-” 表示“再次”，precipitate 在化学中是“（使）沉淀”。日常英语里较少用，更多见于实验步骤、论文或说明书。
与之相关的常见词：precipitate（沉淀/使沉淀）、precipitation（沉淀作用）、recrystallize（重结晶，常用于纯化；有时会伴随重新形成晶体）。

summary.en: Reprecipitation means making a substance precipitate again, often to purify it.
summary.zh: reprecipitation 指让物质再次形成沉淀，常用于纯化。

definition.en: the process of precipitating a substance again (often after dissolving it), usually to purify it or separate it from impurities
definition.zh: （通常先溶解后）再次使物质形成沉淀的过程；多用于纯化或分离杂质

examples.en: In the lab, the sample was dissolved and purified by reprecipitation.
examples.zh: 在实验室里，样品先被溶解，再通过再沉淀法进行纯化。

examples.en: Reprecipitation helps remove soluble impurities from the solid product.
examples.zh: 再沉淀有助于去除固体产物中的可溶性杂质。

extraExplanation: 这是分析化学与材料/高分子领域常见的“纯化”步骤：先用合适溶剂把固体溶解，再加入“不良溶剂”（非溶剂）让目标物重新沉淀出来，杂质留在溶液中。
与“recrystallization（重结晶）”相似，但重结晶强调形成晶体；reprecipitation 更强调“沉淀再次生成”，未必形成规则晶体。

summary.en: “Repredict” means to make a prediction again, often after new information or a new method.
summary.zh: “repredict”表示在有新信息或新方法后再次/重新做出预测。

definition.en: to predict again, especially after getting new information or using a new model or method
definition.zh: 重新预测；（尤指在获得新信息或使用新模型/方法后）再预测

examples.en: After we added the new data, the system had to repredict next month’s sales.
examples.zh: 加入新数据后，系统必须重新预测下个月的销量。

examples.en: Scientists repredict the storm’s path every few hours as conditions change.
examples.zh: 随着条件变化，科学家每隔几小时就会重新预测风暴路径。

examples.en: If the first forecast is wrong, we can repredict using a different approach.
examples.zh: 如果第一次预测不准，我们可以用不同的方法重新预测。

extraExplanation: “repredict”由前缀 re-（表示“再次/重新”）+ predict 组成，意思很直观，但在日常英语中相对少见。更常见的说法有：predict again / make a new prediction / revise the prediction（修正预测）。
在数据分析和机器学习语境里更容易见到它：例如模型更新后对结果进行“重新预测”。

summary.en: Reprefer means to prefer or choose something again (a rare, formal verb).
summary.zh: Reprefer 指“再次更偏好/重新选择”，是一个较少见、较正式的动词。

definition.en: to prefer again, or to choose something (or someone) again instead of another option
definition.zh: 再次更偏好；重新选择（某事/某人）而不是另一个选项

examples.en: After trying the new software, I reprefer the old version because it’s faster.
examples.zh: 试用新软件后，我又更喜欢旧版本，因为它更快。

examples.en: If the schedule changes, I may reprefer the morning flight.
examples.zh: 如果行程有变，我可能会再次选择早班机。

definition.en: (formal/rare) to express preference for something again; to state a renewed preference
definition.zh: （正式/少见）再次表明对某事的偏好；重申偏好

examples.en: In her final email, she repreferred working remotely.
examples.zh: 在她最后一封邮件里，她再次表明更倾向于远程办公。

extraExplanation: “reprefer”在现代英语中非常少见，很多情况下母语者更常用“prefer … again / prefer … over … again”“go back to”“return to”“revert to（更正式）”来表达同样意思。
拼写与用法上要注意：过去式/过去分词通常写作“repreferred”，现在分词“repreferring”，和“prefer”的双写规则一致（-fer 结尾在重读音节时双写 r）。

summary.en: “Reprehend” means to criticize or scold someone for doing something wrong, often in a formal or serious way.
summary.zh: “reprehend”指因某人做错事而批评或责备，语气常较正式或严肃。

definition.en: to criticize or scold someone because you think they did something wrong (often in a formal or serious way)
definition.zh: 因认为某人做错事而批评、责备（常较正式或严肃）

examples.en: The teacher reprimanded him for cheating on the test.
examples.zh: 老师因他考试作弊而训斥了他。

examples.en: Her manager reprimanded her for being late again.
examples.zh: 她的经理因她再次迟到而责备了她。

examples.en: He was reprimanded for speaking rudely to a customer.
examples.zh: 他因对顾客说话无礼而受到责备。

definition.en: to disapprove of something or see it as wrong; to blame (less common in everyday conversation)
definition.zh: 不赞成某事、认为其不对；责难（口语中较少见）

examples.en: Some people reprehend the use of violence in any form.
examples.zh: 有些人谴责任何形式的暴力。

examples.en: She reprehended the decision as unfair to students.
examples.zh: 她指责这个决定对学生不公平。

extraExplanation: “Reprehend”语气偏正式，日常更常用的替代词有：criticize（批评）、scold（训斥）、reprimand（正式训诫）、blame（责怪）。
注意拼写：reprehend 不是 “reprimand”。两者意思接近，但 reprimand 更强调“正式训诫/处分式的责备”。

summary.en: “Reprehendable” means “deserving blame or criticism,” but it’s uncommon; “reprehensible” is more common.
summary.zh: reprehendable 意为“应受责备/批评的”，但较少用；更常见的是 reprehensible（应受谴责的）。

definition.en: Deserving blame, criticism, or reprimand; able to be reproved.
definition.zh: 应受责备的；值得批评或训斥的。

examples.en: Lying to a friend is reprehendable behavior.
examples.zh: 对朋友撒谎是应受责备的行为。

examples.en: The report called the manager’s actions reprehendable and unprofessional.
examples.zh: 报告称这位经理的行为应受谴责，而且不专业。

extraExplanation: “reprehendable”在现代英语里比较少见，更常用的词是“reprehensible”（应受谴责的，道德上可憎的）。如果你想表达更强烈的道德否定，优先用reprehensible；如果只是一般意义上的“该被批评/训斥”，也可以用blameworthy或criticizable。
词源上与动词reprehend（责备、训斥）同源，来自拉丁语reprehendere（抓住、指责）。在正式写作中，用更常见的同义词通常更自然。

summary.en: Reprehendatory means “expressing reprimand or strong disapproval,” but it is rare in modern English.
summary.zh: reprehendatory 表示“带责备/训斥、强烈不赞同的”，但在现代英语中很少用。

definition.en: Expressing strong disapproval or criticism; meant to reprimand.
definition.zh: 表示强烈不赞同或批评的；带有训斥、责备意味的。

examples.en: His tone was reprimanding and reprehendatory, as if I had broken an important rule.
examples.zh: 他的语气带着训斥和责备，好像我违反了什么重要规定。

examples.en: The manager sent a reprehendatory email about repeated lateness.
examples.zh: 经理发了一封责备性质的邮件，批评大家反复迟到。

extraExplanation: “reprehendatory”非常少见，很多情况下更常用的是“reprehensory / reprehensive / reproachful / admonishing”等词。
词形上可理解为由动词“reprehend（责备，斥责）”加上形容词后缀“-atory（……性质的）”构成，含义相当于“用于责备的/责备式的”。
在写作中，如果想更自然、常见一些：正式语境可用“reprehensory / reproachful”，口语或一般文章常用“critical / scolding / disapproving”。

summary.en: “Reprehended” means someone was formally scolded or criticized for wrongdoing.
summary.zh: “reprehended”表示因做错事而受到正式训斥或谴责。

definition.en: scolded or criticized someone formally because you thought they did something wrong
definition.zh: （因认为对方做错事而）正式训斥、责备、谴责了某人

examples.en: The teacher reprehended him for cheating on the test.
examples.zh: 老师因他考试作弊而训斥了他。

examples.en: She was reprehended by her manager for arriving late again.
examples.zh: 她因再次迟到而被经理责备。

examples.en: The report reprehended the company for unsafe working conditions.
examples.zh: 报告谴责该公司工作环境不安全。

extraExplanation: “reprehend”语气偏正式、书面，日常口语里更常用“scold / criticize / reprimand”。
常见结构：reprehend sb. for (doing) sth.（因……而责备某人）。
在宗教或文学语境中也常见，用来表示“指责/规劝某人的错误”，语气可能比“scold”更严肃、更道德化。

summary.en: A “reprehender” is someone who criticizes or reproves others, often in a stern way.
summary.zh: “reprehender”指责备或申斥他人的人，语气常偏严厉。

definition.en: a person who reproves or criticizes someone (someone who gives a reprimand)
definition.zh: 责备者；训斥他人的人（会对别人提出批评或申斥的人）

examples.en: In the meeting, he acted as a constant reprehender of everyone’s ideas.
examples.zh: 在会议上，他像是一直在责备大家想法的那个人。

examples.en: No one likes a reprehender who never offers help or solutions.
examples.zh: 没人喜欢那种只会训斥、却从不提供帮助或解决方案的人。

extraExplanation: “reprehender”在现代英语里比较少见，更常用的表达是“critic”（批评者）、“reprimander”（训斥者）或直接用动词“reprehend /ˌrɛprɪˈhɛnd/”（责备、申斥）。
词根来自拉丁语：re-（再、回）+ prehendere（抓住），引申为“抓住错误并指出”，因此带有“严厉责备”的语气。

summary.en: “Reprehending” means criticizing or scolding someone strongly, often in a formal way.
summary.zh: “reprehending”指（以较正式的语气）严厉地批评或责备某人。

definition.en: (present participle of “reprehend”) expressing strong disapproval of someone’s actions; criticizing or scolding (often in a formal tone).
definition.zh: （reprehend 的现在分词）对某人的行为表示强烈不赞成；责备、训斥（语气常较正式）。

examples.en: She was reprehending him for lying to the team.
examples.zh: 她在责备他对团队撒谎。

examples.en: The teacher stood at the door, reprehending students who arrived late.
examples.zh: 老师站在门口，训斥迟到的学生。

examples.en: The report criticizes the policy, reprehending officials for ignoring safety rules.
examples.zh: 报告批评了该政策，并谴责官员无视安全规定。

extraExplanation: “reprehend”较为正式，常见于新闻、法律或严肃写作；日常口语里更常用“scold / criticize / tell someone off”。
词源来自拉丁语 re-（回、再）+ prehendere（抓住），引申为“抓住错误并加以责备”。

summary.en: “Reprehends” means “criticizes or scolds formally for wrongdoing.”
summary.zh: “reprehends”表示“以正式、严厉的方式批评或责备（某人的错误行为）”。

definition.en: to criticize or scold someone formally for doing something wrong (third-person singular of “reprehend”)
definition.zh: （正式用语）严厉批评或责备某人做错事；指“reprehend”的第三人称单数形式

examples.en: The teacher reprehends students who cheat on exams.
examples.zh: 老师会严厉批评考试作弊的学生。

examples.en: She reprehends him for lying to the team.
examples.zh: 她因他对团队撒谎而责备他。

examples.en: The report reprehends the company for unsafe working conditions.
examples.zh: 这份报告谴责该公司工作条件不安全。

extraExplanation: “reprehend”语气正式、书面，常见于新闻、报告、学术或法律语境，日常口语里更常用“scold / criticize / tell someone off”。
常见搭配：reprehend sb for (doing) sth（因……而责备某人）。
易混词：reprimand（上级/权威“训诫、申斥”，更像正式警告）、rebuke（当面严厉斥责）、condemn（更强烈：谴责，常用于对行为/制度的道德评判）。

summary.en: Reprehensibility means the degree to which something deserves moral blame.
summary.zh: reprehensibility 指某事在道德上应受谴责、值得被强烈责备的程度。

definition.en: the quality of being morally wrong or deserving strong blame; blameworthiness
definition.zh: （道德上）应受谴责的程度；可责性；罪责

examples.en: The report emphasized the reprehensibility of abusing power for personal gain.
examples.zh: 报告强调了为个人利益滥用权力的可责性。

examples.en: Many people agreed on the reprehensibility of the scam, even if they disagreed about the punishment.
examples.zh: 许多人都认同这场骗局的应受谴责之处，即使他们对惩罚方式有分歧。

extraExplanation: 词源提示：reprehensibility 来自 reprehensible（“应受谴责的”），而 reprehensible 源于拉丁语 *reprehendere*（抓住、责备）。因此它强调“道德上站不住脚，值得被严厉批评”。
用法建议：这是较正式、书面化的词，常见于新闻报道、法律/伦理讨论、学术写作中。日常口语里更常用 *wrongness*（错误/不当）、*badness*（不好）、*shamefulness*（可耻）或 *blameworthiness*（可责性）。
搭配常见：the reprehensibility of + 行为（the reprehensibility of lying/violence/corruption）；强调程度时可用 *extreme/clear/obvious reprehensibility*。

summary.en: Reprehensible means morally wrong and deserving strong blame.
summary.zh: reprehensible 指“在道德上错误、因此应受严厉谴责的”。

definition.en: Deserving strong criticism or blame because it is morally wrong or unacceptable.
definition.zh: （行为等）应受严厉谴责的；道德上不可接受的。

examples.en: Lying to gain someone’s trust is reprehensible.
examples.zh: 为了获取别人的信任而撒谎是应受谴责的。

examples.en: The report described the abuse as reprehensible conduct.
examples.zh: 报告将这种虐待称为应受谴责的行为。

extraExplanation: “reprehensible”语气很强，通常用于道德判断（如欺骗、虐待、剥削、歧视等），比“bad”更严厉，接近“shameful / disgraceful”。
词源上与“reprehend”（责备、训斥）同源，表示“值得被责备的”。在正式写作、新闻报道、评论文章中很常见。
常见搭配：reprehensible behavior/conduct/act；It is reprehensible to + 动词（如 to exploit workers）。
注意区分：reprehensible（应受谴责的，形容事/行为） vs. reprehensible person（应受谴责的人，较少见但可用）；reprehension 是“责备/谴责”（名词）。

summary.en: Reprehensibleness means the degree or quality of being morally wrong and deserving blame.
summary.zh: reprehensibleness 指“应受谴责的性质或程度”，即道德上错误、该被责备的程度。

definition.en: the quality of being morally wrong or deserving blame; blameworthiness
definition.zh: 应受谴责的性质；道德上错误、应被责备的程度

examples.en: The judge commented on the reprehensibleness of the defendant’s actions.
examples.zh: 法官评论了被告行为的应受谴责程度。

examples.en: Many people were shocked by the reprehensibleness of the scam.
examples.zh: 许多人对这场骗局的可谴责性（卑劣程度）感到震惊。

examples.en: They argued about the reprehensibleness of lying to protect a friend.
examples.zh: 他们争论为了保护朋友而说谎是否应受谴责。

extraExplanation: “reprehensibleness”是由形容词“reprehensible（应受谴责的）”加名词后缀“-ness（……的性质/状态）”构成，意思就是“应受谴责这一性质”。
这个词比较正式、偏学术或法律语境；日常英语里更常用“how wrong it is（有多不对）”“how blameworthy it is（有多该被责备）”，或直接用“reprehensibility”。
相关词：reprehensible（adj. 应受谴责的）；reprehend（v. 责备，训斥，正式用语）。

summary.en: “Reprehensibly” means “in a blameworthy, morally wrong way.”
summary.zh: “reprehensibly”表示“以应受谴责、在道德上错误的方式”。

definition.en: In a way that deserves strong blame or criticism; in a morally wrong way.
definition.zh: 以应受严厉谴责的方式；在道德上错误、该被强烈指责地。

examples.en: The company acted reprehensibly by hiding safety problems from the public.
examples.zh: 这家公司隐瞒安全问题，对公众不透明，这种做法令人谴责。

examples.en: He spoke reprehensibly to the staff, insulting them in front of customers.
examples.zh: 他当着顾客的面侮辱员工，说话方式令人谴责。

extraExplanation: “reprehensibly”来自形容词“reprehensible（应受谴责的）”，再加副词后缀“-ly”。常用于较正式的语境（新闻、评论、法律/伦理讨论），语气比“badly”更强，强调道德层面的错误。
常见搭配：act/behave reprehensibly（行为可憎）、reprehensibly dishonest（卑劣地不诚实）、reprehensibly negligent（严重失职地）。
易混词提示：reprehensibly（该被责备）≠ responsibly（负责任地）；也不同于“regrettably（遗憾地）”，后者未必带道德谴责。

summary.en: Reprehension means strong disapproval or blame.
summary.zh: Reprehension 指强烈的不赞同或责备（谴责）。

definition.en: Strong disapproval or blame for something someone has done.
definition.zh: （对某人的行为）强烈的不赞同、谴责；责备。

examples.en: She spoke with clear reprehension about the unfair decision.
examples.zh: 她对那个不公平的决定表达了明确的谴责。

examples.en: His comments drew reprehension from the public.
examples.zh: 他的言论引起了公众的谴责。

extraExplanation: 词源提示：reprehension 来自拉丁语根，和 reprove（责备、训斥）同源，核心含义是“指出错误并加以责备”。
用法对比：reprehension 比 criticism（批评）更强烈，带有“道德或行为层面的责难”；但通常又比 condemnation（严厉定罪/强烈谴责，常用于正式或公众场合）稍弱一些、范围更日常。
常见搭配：express/show/voice reprehension（表达谴责）；draw/attract reprehension（招致谴责）；public/official reprehension（公众/官方谴责）。

summary.en: “Reprehensions” means strong criticisms or expressions of disapproval (plural).
summary.zh: “reprehensions”指（复数）严厉的批评或责备，带有明显的不赞成/谴责意味。

definition.en: Strong criticism or an official expression of disapproval (plural).
definition.zh: 严厉的批评；责备；（正式的）谴责（复数）。

examples.en: The manager issued several reprimands and harsh reprehensions for repeated lateness.
examples.zh: 经理因反复迟到给出了几次书面警告和严厉责备。

examples.en: She accepted the reprehensions quietly and promised to improve.
examples.zh: 她平静地接受了责备，并承诺会改进。

extraExplanation: “reprehensions”是“reprehension”的复数，语气比一般的“criticism（批评）”更强，常带有道德或纪律层面的“不赞成/谴责”。
词源来自拉丁语 *reprehendere*（抓住、指责），因此在正式写作中常见，口语里更常用“criticism / scolding / reprimand”。

summary.en: Reprehensive means showing strong disapproval or blame in a critical way.
summary.zh: reprehensive 指“带责备的、严厉批评的”，多形容语气、言辞或态度。

definition.en: (of a person, remark, or tone) showing strong disapproval; critical and blaming.
definition.zh: （指人、言论或语气）表示强烈不赞成；严厉批评、带责备的。

examples.en: She gave him a reprehensive look when he arrived late again.
examples.zh: 他又迟到了，她用责备的眼神看了他一眼。

examples.en: His reprehensive tone made the students fall silent.
examples.zh: 他严厉的语气让学生们安静了下来。

examples.en: The editor wrote a reprehensive note about the careless mistakes.
examples.zh: 编辑写了一段严厉的批注，批评这些粗心的错误。

extraExplanation: 这个词比较少见，常见于正式/书面语。它来自拉丁语词根，和“reprehend（责备、训斥）”同源。
学习者常把 reprehensive 和 reprehensible 混淆：reprehensive = “责备人的、批评的（语气/态度）”；reprehensible = “应受谴责的、可耻的（行为本身）”。例如：a reprehensive remark（责备的话） vs. a reprehensible act（卑劣的行为）。

summary.en: “Reprehensively” means “in a blaming, disapproving way.”
summary.zh: “reprehensively”表示“以责备、谴责的方式”。

definition.en: In a disapproving or critical way; expressing blame or strong criticism.
definition.zh: 以责备的方式；带有谴责、强烈批评地。

examples.en: She spoke reprehensively about the cheating scandal.
examples.zh: 她以严厉谴责的口吻谈到那起作弊丑闻。

examples.en: The article reprehensively criticized the company’s unsafe practices.
examples.zh: 那篇文章以谴责性的语气批评了公司不安全的做法。

extraExplanation: “reprehensively”比较少见，通常出现在正式或书面语中。更常用的替代表达有：“disapprovingly”（不赞成地）、“critically”（批评地）、“sternly”（严厉地）。
词源上与拉丁语 re-（再次）+ prehendere（抓住）有关，含义延伸为“抓住错误并加以责备/指摘”。

summary.en: “Reprehensory” means disapproving or scolding—showing blame or criticism.
summary.zh: “reprehensory”意为“责备的、斥责的、表示不赞成或批评的”。

definition.en: Expressing blame, disapproval, or criticism; scolding in tone.
definition.zh: 表示责备、反对或批评的；带有斥责语气的。

examples.en: The teacher gave him a reprehensory look for talking during the test.
examples.zh: 老师因他考试时说话而投以责备的眼神。

examples.en: Her reprehensory remarks made everyone feel uncomfortable.
examples.zh: 她带有斥责意味的话让大家都很不自在。

extraExplanation: “reprehensory”来自拉丁语词根 *reprehendere*（抓住、责备），常见于较正式或书面语。日常口语里更常用 **disapproving**（不赞成的）、**critical**（批评的）、**scolding**（训斥的）。

注意与 **reprehensible**（应受谴责的，指行为/事物本身很糟糕）区分：
- *reprehensory tone* = 责备的语气（说话方式）
- *reprehensible behavior* = 应受谴责的行为（行为本身）

summary.en: Repremise means to move to new premises (relocate) or, less commonly, to set up an argument again with a new/repeated premise.
summary.zh: repremise 指“迁到新的场所（搬迁）”，较少见的用法是“重新设定/提出前提来重构论证”。

definition.en: to move a business, activity, or people to new premises (a new building or location); to rehouse or relocate
definition.zh: 把企业/活动/人员迁到新的场所；重新安置；搬迁

examples.en: The company repremised its call center to a cheaper office across town.
examples.zh: 这家公司把客服中心搬到了城里更便宜的办公楼。

examples.en: After the fire, the school was repremised in temporary classrooms.
examples.zh: 火灾后，学校被临时安置在临时教室里。

definition.en: to state or set up again as a premise; to base an argument on a new or repeated premise
definition.zh: 重新提出（或设定）前提；以新的（或重复的）前提来构建论证

examples.en: To answer the criticism, the writer repremised the argument on clearer evidence.
examples.zh: 为了回应批评，作者以更清晰的证据作为前提重新构建了论证。

extraExplanation: “repremise”在现代英语里不算常见，更多会看到带连字符的写法“re-premise”，尤其在商业/房产语境中表示“迁址”。日常更常用的替代词是“relocate / move premises / rehouse”。
第二个义项更偏逻辑或写作语境：把论证“换前提/重设前提”。在一般写作里也可以用“reframe the argument”或“restate the premise(s)”更清楚。

summary.en: “Repremised” means “based again on a new premise; re-established the underlying assumptions.” It’s rare and often written “re-premised.”
summary.zh: “Repremised”表示“用新的前提重新作为基础；重新确立基本假设”，较少见，常写作“re-premised”。

definition.en: (rare) Past tense or past participle of “repremise” (often written “re-premise”): to base something again on a new or revised premise; to restate the underlying assumptions of an argument, plan, or story.
definition.zh: （少见）“repremise / re-premise”的过去式或过去分词：用新的或修订后的前提重新作为基础；重新陈述论证、计划或故事的基本假设。

examples.en: After the new research came out, the team repremised the project around different assumptions.
examples.zh: 新研究结果发布后，团队用不同的假设重新为项目设定前提。

examples.en: The editor asked the writer to repremise the story so the main conflict felt more believable.
examples.zh: 编辑要求作者重新设定故事的前提，让主要冲突更可信。

extraExplanation: “repremised”不是常见词，更多见于学术写作、批判性讨论或编剧/策划语境中，意思接近“reframe（重新框架化）”“rethink（重新思考）”“recast（重新构想）”。
更常见的写法是带连字符的“re-premised”，尤其在正式英文中。若你在某篇文章里看到它，通常是在强调：不是改细节，而是换掉或重写最底层的“premise（前提/设定）”。

summary.en: Repremising (more commonly written re-premising) means either reframing an argument using new premises, or (in IT) moving systems back on‑premises.
summary.zh: repremising（更常写作 re-premising）可指用新前提重建/重框论证，也可指（IT中）把系统从云端迁回本地部署。

definition.en: (rare) to set up an argument, plan, or discussion again by choosing new starting assumptions (“premises”); to reframe something from new premises.
definition.zh: （较少见）用新的“前提/假设”重新建立论证、计划或讨论；从新的前提出发重新界定问题。

examples.en: To solve the debate, we may need to re-premise the discussion on shared facts.
examples.zh: 要解决这场争论，我们可能需要以共同事实为基础重新设定讨论前提。

examples.en: The author re-premises the moral question by changing what counts as responsibility.
examples.zh: 作者通过改变“责任”的定义，重新设定了这道道德问题的前提。

definition.en: (business/IT) to move systems or work back to an on‑premises environment (from the cloud or another location).
definition.zh: （商业/IT）把系统或工作负载迁回本地部署/自建机房（从云端或其他地点迁回）。

examples.en: Some companies are re-premising parts of their data for cost and control.
examples.zh: 一些公司为了成本和可控性，正把部分数据迁回本地部署。

examples.en: Re-premising the app reduced monthly cloud fees.
examples.zh: 把应用迁回本地部署降低了每月的云服务费用。

extraExplanation: “repremising”多半是“re-premising”（现在分词/动名词）的拼写形式；在日常英语里不常见。
在学术写作里，它更接近“从新的前提出发重新论证/重新框定问题”；在科技圈（尤其云计算）里，则常指“从云迁回本地（on‑prem）”，也有人写作“re-on-premise / repatriate workloads”。

summary.en: Repreparation means preparing something again.
summary.zh: repreparation 指“再次准备；重新筹备”。

definition.en: the act of preparing something again (after changes, a failure, or a delay)
definition.zh: 重新准备；再次筹备（通常因变更、失败或延期而再做准备）

examples.en: After the event was postponed, the team began the repreparation of the venue.
examples.zh: 活动延期后，团队开始重新准备场地。

examples.en: The report needed major edits, so it went through a full repreparation before submission.
examples.zh: 报告需要大幅修改，因此在提交前经历了完整的重新准备。

extraExplanation: “repreparation”在现代英语中比较少见，更多时候人们会用更自然的表达：re-preparation（加连字符）、preparation again、prepare again，或根据语境用revision（修订）、redoing（重做）、rehearsal（再次排练）等。
前缀re-表示“再次”，接在preparation（准备）前面，构成“再次准备”的意思；写作时加连字符re-preparation更清晰，也更常见。

summary.en: Reprepare means to prepare again or become ready again.
summary.zh: reprepare 意为“再次准备/重新准备好”。

definition.en: to prepare again; to get something ready a second time (often after changes, mistakes, or new requirements)
definition.zh: 再次准备；重新把某事/某物准备好（常因更改、出错或有新要求）

examples.en: We had to reprepare the presentation after the client changed the schedule.
examples.zh: 客户更改了日程后，我们不得不重新准备演示。

examples.en: Please reprepare the documents and submit them by Friday.
examples.zh: 请把文件重新准备好，并在周五前提交。

definition.en: to make yourself ready again, especially mentally or physically
definition.zh: （尤指在心理或体力上）再次做好准备

examples.en: After the short break, the team reprepared for the second half of the match.
examples.zh: 短暂休息后，球队重新为下半场做好准备。

extraExplanation: “reprepare”由前缀 re-（“再次”）+ prepare 组成，意思很直观，但在日常英语中更常见的说法是 “prepare again” 或 “redo the preparation”。在正式写作、项目管理、流程文件中，“reprepare”会更常出现。
拼写上有时也会写作带连字符的 “re-prepare”，用来强调“重新”的动作，尤其在需要避免误读时。

summary.en: “Reprepared” means prepared again, usually because something changed.
summary.zh: “reprepared”表示“重新准备（过）”，通常因为情况有变化。

definition.en: (past tense/past participle of “reprepare”) to prepare something again, often after a change, mistake, or new requirement.
definition.zh: （“reprepare”的过去式/过去分词）重新准备某物，常因需求变化、错误或需要更新而再次准备。

examples.en: After the schedule changed, we reprepared the presentation for Monday.
examples.zh: 日程变了之后，我们把周一的演示重新准备了一遍。

examples.en: The documents were reprepared to include the new address.
examples.zh: 这些文件已重新准备，以加入新的地址信息。

definition.en: (adjective) prepared again; made ready again.
definition.zh: （形容词）重新准备好的；再次就绪的。

examples.en: The reprepared meal was ready to serve in minutes.
examples.zh: 重新准备好的餐点几分钟就能上桌。

examples.en: With a reprepared plan, the team felt more confident.
examples.zh: 有了重新准备过的计划，团队更有信心了。

extraExplanation: “reprepared”在日常英语里不算常见，更常见的表达是“prepared again / re-prepared”或用更自然的动词替换：如“revised”（修订后再准备）、“redid”（重做）、“updated”（更新）。
在正式写作中，如果你用“reprepared”，建议加连字符“re-prepared”以便读者更快看懂前缀re-（再次）。

summary.en: “Repreparing” means preparing something again.
summary.zh: “repreparing” 指“重新准备、再次准备”。

definition.en: present participle of reprepare: preparing something again (often after changes, mistakes, or new requirements).
definition.zh: reprepare 的现在分词：再次准备某事（常因变更、错误或新要求而重新准备）。

examples.en: We’re repreparing the presentation because the client changed the deadline.
examples.zh: 因为客户改了截止日期，我们正在重新准备这份演示。

examples.en: The chef is repreparing the sauce after tasting it.
examples.zh: 厨师尝过后正在重新调制这份酱汁。

extraExplanation: “re-” 是英语中很常见的前缀，表示“再一次/重新”。因此 repreparing 通常暗示：之前已经准备过，但需要调整、修正或从头再来。
在正式写作里，repreparing 常用于工作场景（文件、报告、计划、演示等）或流程场景（数据、设备、材料）。口语中也常用 “prepare again / redo the preparation” 来表达同样意思。

summary.en: Represcribe means to prescribe a medicine or treatment again.
summary.zh: Represcribe 指再次开具药物或治疗处方。

definition.en: to prescribe (a medicine or treatment) again, often after reviewing a patient’s condition or renewing an old prescription
definition.zh: （在复诊或续方时）再次开具（药物或治疗方案）；重新处方

examples.en: The doctor decided to represcribe the antibiotic because the infection returned.
examples.zh: 因为感染复发，医生决定再次开同一种抗生素。

examples.en: If your symptoms come back, your provider may represcribe the same medication at a different dose.
examples.zh: 如果症状复发，医护人员可能会以不同剂量重新处方同一种药物。

examples.en: The clinic can’t automatically represcribe controlled substances without a new evaluation.
examples.zh: 诊所不能在没有重新评估的情况下自动再次开具受管制药物。

extraExplanation: “represcribe”在日常英语中不算常用，医疗沟通里更常见的说法包括：renew a prescription（续方）、re-prescribe/prescribe again（重新开药）、refill a prescription（续配/补配）。注意：refill通常指药房按原处方配药；re-prescribe更强调医生再次开具处方（可能调整剂量或用药方案）。

summary.en: Represcribed means a doctor prescribed a medication again (renewed or reissued a prescription).
summary.zh: Represcribed 指医生把药物“再次开处方”（续开或重新开具处方）。

definition.en: (medicine) Prescribed again, often to renew a prescription or to change it and issue a new one.
definition.zh: （医学）再次开处方；常指续开处方，或调整用药后重新开具新的处方。

examples.en: After reviewing the side effects, the doctor represcribed the medicine at a lower dose.
examples.zh: 医生评估副作用后，把药物改为更低剂量并重新开了处方。

examples.en: The antibiotic was represcribed because the infection came back.
examples.zh: 因为感染复发，医生又重新开了抗生素处方。

examples.en: Your inhaler was represcribed, so you can pick it up at the pharmacy today.
examples.zh: 你的吸入器已重新开具处方，所以今天可以去药房领取。

extraExplanation: “represcribed”是动词“represcribe”的过去式/过去分词，常见于医疗记录、处方系统或保险沟通中。它可能表示：①处方到期后续开（renew/refill with a new order）；②换药或改剂量后重新开具（reissue/adjust）。具体含义通常要看上下文。

summary.en: Represcribing means prescribing a medication again, often as a renewal or after reviewing the patient’s condition.
summary.zh: Represcribing 指再次开具药物处方，常见于续方或复诊评估后重新开药。

definition.en: the act of prescribing a medicine or treatment again (often renewing it after a review)
definition.zh: 再次开具药物或治疗处方（常指复诊后续开/重新开）

examples.en: The doctor is represcribing the same inhaler because it still works well for her asthma.
examples.zh: 医生再次开了同一种吸入器，因为它对她的哮喘仍然有效。

examples.en: After checking his blood pressure, the clinic started represcribing his medication monthly.
examples.zh: 在检查血压后，诊所开始每月为他续开处方药。

definition.en: prescribing a medicine again, sometimes with changes in dose, brand, or instructions
definition.zh: 再次开处方（有时会调整剂量、品牌或用法说明）

examples.en: The pharmacist called the office before represcribing to confirm the new dosage.
examples.zh: 药剂师在重新开具处方前给诊所打电话确认新剂量。

examples.en: She is represcribing antibiotics only if the infection returns.
examples.zh: 只有在感染复发时，她才会再次开抗生素。

extraExplanation: 在医疗英语里，represcribe 常用于“重新开药/续方”，强调医生在评估后再次开具处方；也可表示因不良反应或疗效不佳而“改开另一种药”或“调整剂量后再开”。
写法上既可见到 represcribe，也常见 hyphen 形式 re-prescribe（更直观地表示“再一次开方”）。在正式病历或药房系统中，两种写法都可能出现。

summary.en: Represent means to act for someone, to symbolize something, or to portray/show something.
summary.zh: represent 可指“代表某人”“象征某物”，也可指“描绘/呈现某事”。

definition.en: To act or speak for someone, especially as an official delegate or advocate.
definition.zh: 代表（某人）行事或发言，尤指作为正式代表或代理人。

examples.en: She was chosen to represent the class at the student council meeting.
examples.zh: 她被选去在学生会会议上代表全班发言。

examples.en: The lawyer will represent you in court.
examples.zh: 律师会在法庭上代表你。

definition.en: To be a symbol of something, or to show an idea or meaning.
definition.zh: 象征；表示（某种意义或观念）。

examples.en: In many cultures, the dove represents peace.
examples.zh: 在许多文化中，鸽子象征和平。

examples.en: The color red can represent luck in China.
examples.zh: 红色在中国可以代表好运。

definition.en: To describe, portray, or show something in words, art, data, or performance.
definition.zh: 描绘；呈现；表达（用文字、艺术、数据或表演等方式）。

examples.en: The chart represents changes in temperature over time.
examples.zh: 这张图表呈现了温度随时间变化的情况。

examples.en: The novel represents city life with vivid details.
examples.zh: 这部小说用生动的细节描绘了城市生活。

definition.en: To officially state something; to claim or assert (often in formal contexts).
definition.zh: 正式陈述；声称（常见于正式语境）。

examples.en: He represented that the information was correct.
examples.zh: 他正式声明该信息是正确的。

extraExplanation: “represent”常见搭配：represent someone (in court / at a meeting) 表示“代表某人（出庭/在会议上）”；represent something as something 表示“把……描述/呈现为……”；be represented by 表示“由……代表/体现”。
与“present”不同：present 更偏“呈现/展示（给观众）”，represent 更偏“代表/象征/描绘（某事物的意义或形象）”。
文学与公共话语中常见用法：谈到“representation（再现/代表性/呈现方式）”时，常讨论某群体在媒体、书籍、电影中是否被公平、真实地描绘。

summary.en: Representability means how possible or how well something can be represented (described, shown, or modeled).
summary.zh: Representability 指某事物“能否/多大程度上”被表示、描述或建模（呈现）的可表征性/可表示性。

definition.en: the quality or degree of being able to be represented (shown, described, or modeled), especially in a clear or accurate way
definition.zh: 可表征性；可表示性：指某事物能够被表示、描述或建模（呈现出来）的性质或程度，尤指清楚或准确地呈现

examples.en: The report questions the representability of these numbers because the survey sample was too small.
examples.zh: 报告质疑这些数字的可表征性，因为调查样本太小。

examples.en: In computer science, we discuss whether a problem has representability in a particular data structure.
examples.zh: 在计算机科学中，我们会讨论某个问题能否在特定的数据结构中被表示（是否具备可表示性）。

extraExplanation: “representability”常用于较正式或学术的语境（如数学、计算机科学、语言学、统计学）。日常英语里更常用“can be represented / how well it represents … / representativeness（代表性）”。注意区分：representability（能否/多大程度能被表示）≠ representativeness（是否具有代表性，能代表整体）。
词形结构：represent（表示/代表）+ -able（可…的）→ representable（可表示的）+ -ity（名词后缀）→ representability（可表示性）。

summary.en: Representable means “able to be shown or expressed” (common in math/data), or “able to be represented by someone.”
summary.zh: representable 指“可被呈现/表达的”（在数学与数据语境常见），也可指“可被某人代表的”。

definition.en: Able to be shown, described, or expressed clearly (for example, with words, pictures, symbols, or data).
definition.zh: 可被清楚呈现、描述或表达的（例如用语言、图像、符号或数据）。

examples.en: The chart makes the trend representable in a simple way.
examples.zh: 这张图表用很简单的方式把趋势呈现出来。

examples.en: Some feelings are hard to make representable in words.
examples.zh: 有些感受很难用语言表达清楚。

definition.en: Able to be represented by a representative, spokesperson, or official body.
definition.zh: 可由代表、发言人或官方机构来代表的。

examples.en: Small communities want their needs to be representable in the city council.
examples.zh: 小社区希望他们的需求能在市议会中被代表。

examples.en: Not every group is equally representable in the media.
examples.zh: 并不是每个群体在媒体中都能同等地被代表。

extraExplanation: “representable”在日常口语中不算常见，更常用的替代说法有：able to represent / can be represented / expressible / describable。
在数学、计算机与数据语境里很常见：例如“representable number（可表示的数）”“representable range（可表示范围）”，指能用某种系统或格式准确表示出来。
词形来源：represent（代表；呈现）+ -able（能够…的）。常见搭配：representable as…（可表示为…）、representable by…（可由…表示/代表）。

summary.en: Representably means “in a representative way” (fairly showing typical features) or, less commonly, “in a way that can be represented.”
summary.zh: Representably表示“以具有代表性的方式”，较少见的含义是“以可被表示/呈现的方式”。

definition.en: In a representative way; in a way that fairly shows the main or typical features of a group or situation.
definition.zh: 以具有代表性的方式；以能公平体现某个群体或情况的主要/典型特征的方式。

examples.en: The survey sampled voters representably across age and income groups.
examples.zh: 这项调查在年龄和收入群体之间以具有代表性的方式抽样选取选民。

examples.en: To report representably, you should include both successes and failures.
examples.zh: 要做到具有代表性地报道，你应该同时包含成功与失败的情况。

definition.en: In a way that can be represented (shown, described, or modeled).
definition.zh: 以可被表示/呈现（展示、描述或建模）的方式。

examples.en: The data can be representably organized in a simple table.
examples.zh: 这些数据可以用一种可呈现的方式整理成简单的表格。

extraExplanation: “representably”在现代英语中比较少见，尤其在日常口语里不常用。很多场合更自然的说法是：“in a representative way / representatively”（表示“有代表性地”）或 “in a way that can be represented”（表示“可被呈现地”）。
词形结构：represent（代表/呈现）+ -able（能够…的）+ -ly（以…方式）。因此它常出现在更正式、学术或技术写作中。

summary.en: A representamen is the sign-form (word, image, sound, etc.) that represents something in semiotics, especially in Peirce’s theory.
summary.zh: representamen 指符号学中的“符号形式/载体”（如词语、图像、声音等），用来代表某个对象，尤用于皮尔士的符号理论。

definition.en: (Semiotics) the form of a sign—the thing (sound, word, image, gesture, etc.) that stands for something else (the object) to someone (through an interpretation).
definition.zh: （符号学）符号的“表现项/载体”——指作为符号的形式（声音、词语、图像、手势等），它代表某个“对象”，并通过人的理解产生意义。

examples.en: In Peirce’s theory, a word on the page is a representamen that points to an object through an interpretant.
examples.zh: 在皮尔士的理论中，纸上的一个词是“表现项/载体”（representamen），它通过“解释项”（interpretant）指向某个“对象”（object）。

examples.en: A red traffic light works as a representamen for the idea “stop.”
examples.zh: 红色交通灯作为“表现项/载体”，代表“停止”这一含义。

extraExplanation: 该词常见于美国哲学家查尔斯·桑德斯·皮尔士（Charles S. Peirce）的“三元符号”理论：representamen（表现项/符号载体）— object（对象）— interpretant（解释项/理解效果）。日常语言里较少使用，更多见于符号学、传播学、语言学与文学批评。
有时也会看到拼写变体 **representamen / representans** 或被更通俗的说法替代，如 *sign vehicle*（符号载体）。

summary.en: “Representant” means “representative,” but it’s an uncommon spelling; “representative” is the standard form in English.
summary.zh: “representant”相当于“representative（代表）”，但属于不常见拼写；标准英文通常用“representative”。

definition.en: A less common spelling of “representative” (someone chosen to speak or act for others), sometimes seen under French influence (représentant) or in older/technical writing.
definition.zh: “representative（代表、代理人）”的较少见拼写形式；有时受法语（représentant）影响或出现在较旧/较专业的文本中。

examples.en: Each district elects a representant to speak for local residents.
examples.zh: 每个选区选出一位代表来为当地居民发声。

examples.en: The union’s representant met with management to discuss safety issues.
examples.zh: 工会代表与管理层会面讨论安全问题。

extraExplanation: 在现代标准英语中，更常用也更推荐的拼写是 representative。你在新闻、政府文件里通常会看到 “representative / rep.”。
如果你是在法语背景（例如加拿大魁北克、欧盟文件翻译或双语材料）里看到 representant，它往往是把法语名词 “représentant（代表）” 直接借用/英文化的写法。正式英文写作中建议改为 representative。

summary.en: Representation means the way something is shown or described, a symbol/model that stands for something, or (in law/politics) acting or speaking for someone.
summary.zh: representation 可指“呈现/描绘方式”、指代某物的“象征/示意”，也可指（法律/政治中）“代理/代表”。

definition.en: the act of showing or describing someone or something in a particular way (in words, images, numbers, etc.)
definition.zh: （用文字、图像、数字等）呈现、描绘或表达某人/某物的方式；表现

examples.en: The article criticized the media’s representation of immigrants.
examples.zh: 这篇文章批评了媒体对移民的呈现方式。

examples.en: Her painting is a representation of childhood memories.
examples.zh: 她的画作是对童年记忆的一种表达。

definition.en: a sign, picture, model, map, or symbol that stands for something else
definition.zh: 代表物；象征物（如符号、图像、模型、地图等）

examples.en: This diagram is a simplified representation of the human heart.
examples.zh: 这幅图是人类心脏的简化示意图。

examples.en: A flag can be a representation of a nation.
examples.zh: 国旗可以是一个国家的象征。

definition.en: the act of speaking or acting for someone; official support or advocacy
definition.zh: 代表（某人）发言或行动；（正式的）代理、维护、陈述

examples.en: The union provides legal representation for its members.
examples.zh: 工会为其成员提供法律代理。

examples.en: You have the right to representation in court.
examples.zh: 你有在法庭上获得代理/辩护的权利。

definition.en: a statement made on behalf of someone; a claim or assertion (often in formal or legal contexts)
definition.zh: （正式/法律语境中）陈述；声明；主张（常指代他人所作的说明）

examples.en: The company made representations about the safety of the product.
examples.zh: 该公司就产品安全性作出声明/陈述。

extraExplanation: representation 来自 re-（再、回）+ present（呈现、展示）+ -ation（名词后缀），核心概念是“把某物呈现出来”。因此它既可指“呈现方式”（媒体如何描绘群体），也可指“代表物/符号”（图示、模型），在法律语境里还常指“代理/辩护”（legal representation）。
在文化与媒体讨论中，representation 常与多样性、公平性相关，强调“谁被看见、如何被看见”。例如：representation of women / LGBTQ+ people / minorities（对女性/性少数/少数族裔的呈现）。

summary.en: Representational describes something that represents or depicts reality; in art it often means realistic/figurative, and in politics it relates to representative (elected) systems.
summary.zh: representational 表示“具有表现/代表性质的”；在艺术中常指具象、写实，在政治中常与代议制（由民选代表治理）相关。

definition.en: Related to representing something (showing it, describing it, or standing for it), especially in art, language, or politics.
definition.zh: 与“表现/代表”有关的；指用某种方式呈现、描绘或代指某事物的（常用于艺术、语言或政治语境）。

examples.en: The museum focused on representational painting rather than abstract art.
examples.zh: 这家博物馆以具象绘画为主，而不是抽象艺术。

examples.en: The committee is trying to create a more representational decision-making process.
examples.zh: 该委员会正尝试建立一个更具代表性的决策机制。

definition.en: In politics: based on elected officials who act for the people (representative government).
definition.zh: （政治）指代议制的；由民选代表替人民行使权力的。

examples.en: Many countries have a representational system with regular elections.
examples.zh: 许多国家实行代议制，并定期举行选举。

definition.en: In art/literature: showing recognizable people or objects as they appear in real life (not abstract).
definition.zh: （艺术/文学）指具象的；呈现现实中可辨认的人物或物体，而非抽象表达。

examples.en: Her style is representational, with detailed portraits and landscapes.
examples.zh: 她的风格偏具象，擅长细致的人像与风景描绘。

extraExplanation: “representational”常见于艺术评论中，对比“abstract（抽象的）”。具象（representational）强调“看得出来画的是什么”；抽象则更强调形状、色彩、情绪或观念。
在政治语境里，它常与“representative”关系密切：representational democracy/ government 指“代议民主/代议政府”。日常口语更常说 representative，而 representational 更偏书面或学术表达。
词源上来自 represent（代表、呈现）+ -ational（构成形容词，表示“与……有关的”）。

summary.en: Representationalism is a theory or style that emphasizes representation—especially the philosophical idea that perception gives us mental representations of the world, and the artistic idea of depicting recognizable subjects.
summary.zh: Representationalism 指强调“表象/表征”的理论或风格：常见于哲学上“我们通过心理表象认识世界”的观点，也可用于艺术上“以可辨识方式再现对象”的倾向。

definition.en: (Philosophy) The view that we know the external world indirectly through mental representations (such as ideas, images, or sense-data), rather than through direct contact with objects themselves.
definition.zh: （哲学）表象主义/表征主义：认为我们对外部世界的认识是通过心中的“表象/表征”（如观念、图像、感觉材料）间接获得的，而不是直接接触到对象本身。

examples.en: In representationalism, what you experience is a mental representation shaped by your senses and brain.
examples.zh: 在表象主义看来，你所经验到的是由感官与大脑塑造的心理表象。

examples.en: The debate between representationalism and direct realism asks whether perception gives us the world itself or only a picture of it.
examples.zh: 表象主义与直接实在论的争论在于：知觉呈现的是世界本身，还是世界的一幅“图画”。

definition.en: (Art and media) An approach that emphasizes depicting people, objects, or scenes in a recognizable way (as opposed to abstract styles).
definition.zh: （艺术与媒体）再现主义/具象倾向：强调以可辨识的方式描绘人物、物体或场景（相对抽象风格）。

examples.en: The museum’s modern wing ranges from strict representationalism to pure abstraction.
examples.zh: 博物馆的现代馆藏从严格的再现主义到纯抽象都有。

examples.en: Her early paintings show representationalism, with detailed faces and realistic light.
examples.zh: 她早期的绘画偏再现主义，人物面部细节丰富、光影逼真。

extraExplanation: 在英语学术语境里，representationalism 最常出现在“心灵哲学/知觉哲学”中，经常与 direct realism（直接实在论）、idealism（唯心主义）、sense-data theory（感觉材料理论）等一起讨论。
词形上来自 representation（表象/表征）+ -al + -ism（主义、理论）。中文译名会因学科而不同：哲学里常译“表象主义/表征主义”，艺术语境里常译“再现主义”。

summary.en: A representationalist is someone (or something) that supports the view that we know the world through mental representations rather than direct contact.
summary.zh: representationalist 指主张我们通过心智表象来认识世界的人（或与该观点相关的）。

definition.en: a person who believes that our mind knows the world mainly through mental representations (ideas or images) rather than by direct access to things themselves.
definition.zh: 表象主义者：指认为人类认识世界主要是通过心中的“表象/表征”（观念、心像等），而非直接接触事物本身的人。

examples.en: In the seminar, she argued like a representationalist: we never experience objects directly, only our perceptions of them.
examples.zh: 在研讨课上，她以表象主义者的立场论证：我们从来不是直接经验物体，而只是经验对它们的知觉。

examples.en: Some philosophers contrast representationalists with direct realists in theories of perception.
examples.zh: 在知觉理论中，有些哲学家把表象主义者与直接实在论者作对比。

definition.en: relating to representationalism, especially in philosophy of mind and perception.
definition.zh: （尤指心灵哲学与知觉哲学中）与表象主义/表征主义有关的。

examples.en: The article gives a representationalist account of how we see color.
examples.zh: 这篇文章从表象主义的角度解释我们如何看见颜色。

examples.en: He adopts a representationalist view of perception in his theory.
examples.zh: 他在自己的理论中采用了表象主义的知觉观点。

extraExplanation: “representationalist”常见于哲学语境，尤其讨论“知觉是否直接接触外物”。与之相对的常见立场是“direct realist（直接实在论者）”。
在艺术语境里更常用的是“representational（具象的、再现性的）”，表示画作/作品呈现可辨认的对象；而“representationalist”更偏向“主张再现/表象理论的人”。

summary.en: Representationalistic describes art that depicts recognizable reality, or ideas linked to representationalism in philosophy (knowing through mental representations).
summary.zh: Representationalistic 可指艺术上“具象写实、可辨认的再现”，也可指哲学上与“表征主义”（通过心理表征来认识世界）相关的观点。

definition.en: (of art) aiming to show people or things in a realistic, recognizable way, rather than using abstract forms.
definition.zh: （指艺术）倾向于用写实、可辨认的方式呈现人物或事物，而不是用抽象形式来表达。

examples.en: Her painting style is representationalistic, focusing on everyday scenes and accurate details.
examples.zh: 她的绘画风格偏向具象写实，专注于日常场景和准确细节。

examples.en: The museum’s early collection is more representationalistic than its modern abstract wing.
examples.zh: 博物馆的早期馆藏比它的现代抽象展区更偏向具象写实。

definition.en: (of philosophy or thinking) relating to representationalism: the view that the mind knows the world through mental representations (images/ideas) rather than by direct access to reality.
definition.zh: （指哲学或思想）与“表征主义”有关：认为心灵通过心理表征（图像/观念）来认识世界，而不是直接接触现实本身。

examples.en: His explanation of perception is representationalistic: we experience the world through mental images.
examples.zh: 他对知觉的解释带有表征主义色彩：我们通过心理图像来体验世界。

examples.en: Some critics argue that a representationalistic model cannot fully explain consciousness.
examples.zh: 一些批评者认为，表征主义模型无法充分解释意识。

extraExplanation: “Representationalistic”相对少见，更常见的说法是 **representational**（艺术语境）或 **representationalist**（哲学语境）。它通常用于强调“以表征/再现为核心”的倾向。
词形上常见搭配：**representationalistic art/style/approach**（具象写实艺术/风格/方法）；哲学里常见：**representationalistic theory/view of perception**（表征主义的知觉理论/观点）。

summary.en: Representationally means “in a way that depicts or represents something,” or “in terms of being representative of a group.”
summary.zh: representationally 意为“以表征/再现的方式”，也可指“就代表性而言（能否代表某群体）”。

definition.en: In a way that relates to representation—showing, depicting, or standing for something (often in art, design, language, or symbols).
definition.zh: 以“表征/再现”的方式；与表现、描绘或代表某事有关（常用于艺术、设计、语言或符号）。

examples.en: The scene is representationally accurate, even though the colors are exaggerated.
examples.zh: 这个场景在再现层面是准确的，尽管颜色被夸张了。

examples.en: The logo works representationally because it clearly suggests a mountain.
examples.zh: 这个标志在表征意义上是有效的，因为它清楚地让人联想到山。

definition.en: In a representative sense—according to how well something represents a group, a viewpoint, or real-world variety (often in politics, research, or demographics).
definition.zh: 在“代表性”的意义上；就某事对群体、观点或现实多样性的代表程度而言（常用于政治、研究或人口统计）。

examples.en: The committee is not representationally balanced; it lacks younger voices.
examples.zh: 这个委员会在代表性上不够平衡；缺少年轻人的声音。

examples.en: Representationally, the sample is weak because it includes too few rural participants.
examples.zh: 从代表性来看，这个样本较弱，因为农村参与者太少。

extraExplanation: “representationally”由 representational（表征的/具代表性的）+ -ly（副词后缀）构成，常用于较正式的写作。
在艺术语境中，representational 指“具象/写实”（与 abstract 抽象相对）；在社会科学或政治语境中，常接近“具有代表性/能代表群体”。注意两种语境含义不同，但都围绕“代表/呈现”这个核心。

summary.en: “Representationary” (rare) means “related to representation,” especially in discussions about who or what gets represented and how.
summary.zh: “representationary”（少见）意为“与表征/代表有关的”，常用于讨论谁被代表、如何被呈现等问题。

definition.en: Relating to representation; concerned with how something is shown, depicted, or spoken for (often used in academic writing, and relatively rare).
definition.zh: 与“表征/代表”有关的；关注某事物如何被呈现、描绘或被代表（多见于学术语境，用法较少见）。

examples.en: The author raises a representationary problem: whose voices are included in the history?
examples.zh: 作者提出一个“表征/代表性”的问题：这段历史纳入了谁的声音？

examples.en: Critics argue that the film has representationary limits in portraying immigrant families.
examples.zh: 评论者认为这部电影在呈现移民家庭方面存在“表征上的”局限。

extraExplanation:
“representationary”在日常英语中非常少见，很多情况下人们会用更常用的形容词来表达相近意思：
- representational（偏“表现/描绘方式”，常见于艺术、媒体研究）
- representative（偏“具有代表性/代表某群体”，常见于政治、统计、样本）
如果你是在写论文，选哪个词取决于你想强调“如何呈现（representational）”还是“是否能代表（representative）”。

summary.en: “representationes” is not standard English; it most likely means “representations”: depictions/portrayals or the act of representing someone (e.g., legal representation).
summary.zh: “representationes”不是标准英语拼写；最可能是“representations”：指描绘/呈现，或指代表某人（如法律代理）。

definition.en: (Nonstandard spelling) Likely intended to mean “representations” (plural of representation): the ways something is shown, described, or portrayed; images, symbols, or depictions that stand for something.
definition.zh: （非标准拼写）很可能是想写“representations”（representation 的复数）：指把某事物呈现、描述或描绘的方式；也可指代表某事物的图像、符号或描绘。

examples.en: The film’s representations of history are not always accurate.
examples.zh: 这部电影对历史的呈现并不总是准确。

examples.en: Different cultures have different representations of beauty.
examples.zh: 不同文化对美有不同的表达/呈现方式。

examples.en: These paintings are representations of everyday life.
examples.zh: 这些画是对日常生活的描绘。

definition.en: The act of speaking or acting on behalf of someone; advocacy (often in legal or official contexts).
definition.zh: 代表、代言；为某人发声或采取行动（常用于法律或官方语境）。

examples.en: She hired a lawyer for representation in court.
examples.zh: 她聘请律师在法庭上为她辩护（提供法律代理）。

examples.en: The union provides representation for its members.
examples.zh: 工会为其成员提供代表与维权。

extraExplanation: “representationes”不是现代英语中的标准拼写，看起来像把英语词尾做成拉丁/学术化的形式。标准英语通常写作 **representation**（单数）和 **representations**（复数）。
常见搭配：**representation of**（对……的呈现/描绘），**legal representation**（法律代理），**political representation**（政治代表性），**a representation of reality**（对现实的呈现）。

summary.en: Representationism is the idea that knowledge or art works through representations: the mind uses mental representations to know the world, or art depicts reality in recognizable forms.
summary.zh: 表象主义/再现主义指“通过表象来认识或表现”：在哲学中强调心灵靠心理表象认识世界；在艺术中强调以可辨识的方式再现现实。

definition.en: (Philosophy) The view that the mind knows the world by having mental “representations” (ideas, images, concepts) that stand for or depict things outside the mind.
definition.zh: （哲学）表象主义/再现主义：认为心灵通过内部的“表象”（观念、意象、概念）来认识外部世界；这些表象代表或描绘外在事物。

examples.en: In representationism, perception gives us mental representations rather than direct access to objects themselves.
examples.zh: 在表象主义中，知觉提供的是心中的表象，而不是对物体本身的直接把握。

examples.en: Some philosophers criticize representationism for creating a gap between the mind and reality.
examples.zh: 一些哲学家批评表象主义会在心灵与现实之间制造一道鸿沟。

definition.en: (Art/literature) The idea that art should depict reality by representing people, objects, or events in recognizable ways.
definition.zh: （艺术/文学）再现主义：主张艺术应以可辨识的方式描绘现实中的人物、事物或事件。

examples.en: The painter’s representationism favored realistic scenes over abstract shapes.
examples.zh: 这位画家的再现主义倾向于写实场景，而不是抽象形状。

examples.en: Even within representationism, artists may choose what to emphasize or omit.
examples.zh: 即使在再现主义中，艺术家也会选择强调或省略某些细节。

extraExplanation: 在心灵哲学/认识论里，representationism 常与“直接实在论（direct realism）”形成对比：前者强调我们首先接触到的是心中的表象；后者强调我们在知觉中直接接触到外部对象。
历史上，这种思路常与近代哲学关于“观念（ideas）”的讨论相关（例如洛克等人的传统），但当代讨论也会涉及知觉科学、意识研究等领域。
在艺术语境中，representationism 更接近“具象/写实”的立场，常与“抽象艺术（abstract art）”相对。

summary.en: A representationist is someone who supports representationism (usually in philosophy of perception/knowledge), and less commonly someone who prefers representational (non-abstract) art.
summary.zh: representationist 指主张表象论/表征论的人（多见于哲学语境），较少见时也可指偏好具象再现艺术的人。

definition.en: n. A person who supports or argues for representationism in philosophy—the view that we know the world (or perceive it) through mental representations rather than by direct access to things themselves. Example: “Some representationists say perception gives us a model of reality, not reality itself.”
definition.zh: n. （哲学）主张“表象论/表征论”的人——认为我们认识或感知世界是通过心灵中的表象/表征，而不是直接接触事物本身。例："一些表象论者认为，知觉给我们的是对现实的模型，而不是现实本身。"

examples.en: In debates about perception, the representationist argues that what we experience is a mental representation.
examples.zh: 在关于知觉的辩论中，表象论者主张我们体验到的是心灵表征。

examples.en: She is a representationist, so she doubts that the senses give us the world directly.
examples.zh: 她是表象论者，因此怀疑感官能让我们直接得到世界本身。

definition.en: n. (Less common) A person who favors representational art—art that depicts recognizable people, objects, or scenes, rather than abstract forms. Example: “As a representationist, he prefers portraits to abstract paintings.”
definition.zh: n.（较少见）偏好具象/再现性艺术的人——喜欢描绘可辨认的人物、物体或场景的艺术，而非抽象形式。例："作为具象派的支持者，他更喜欢肖像画而不是抽象画。"

examples.en: Many representationists enjoy landscapes and still-life paintings because the subjects are recognizable.
examples.zh: 许多具象派支持者喜欢风景画和静物画，因为题材清晰可辨。

extraExplanation: “representationist”对应的理论名词是“representationism”。在英语哲学语境里，它常出现在关于知觉（perception）、心灵（mind）与认识论（epistemology）的讨论中，常与“direct realism（直接实在论）”形成对比：前者强调“我们接触到的是表征”，后者强调“我们直接接触到外部世界”。
艺术语境中更常见的词是“representational/representationalist（具象的/具象派）”。“representationist”用于艺术时有时能被理解，但频率较低，写作中用“representational artist”或“representationalist”更自然。

summary.en: “Representations” means portrayals/presentations, symbols or models that stand for something, official representation of a group, or (in law/business) statements made to influence decisions.
summary.zh: “representations”可指描绘/呈现方式、代表或象征物（如图表/符号）、团体的正式代表权，也可指法律/商业语境中的（影响决策的）陈述或声明。

definition.en: The act of showing, describing, or presenting someone or something; the way something is shown to others (often in art, media, or writing).
definition.zh: 表现；描绘；呈现（指通过艺术、媒体、文字等把某人/某事展示出来的方式）。

examples.en: The movie’s representation of history is exciting, but not always accurate.
examples.zh: 这部电影对历史的呈现很精彩，但并不总是准确。

examples.en: There are better representations of this character in the later books.
examples.zh: 在后面的书里，这个角色的描写更好。

definition.en: Something that stands for or symbolizes something else; an image, model, diagram, or sign used to express an idea.
definition.zh: 代表物；象征；表达某个概念的图像、模型、图表或符号。

examples.en: The graph is a visual representation of the data.
examples.zh: 这张图表是数据的可视化表达。

examples.en: A flag can be a powerful representation of a country.
examples.zh: 国旗可以是一个国家强有力的象征。

definition.en: The act of speaking or acting for someone or a group; official representation in politics or organizations.
definition.zh: 代表（某人/某团体发声或行事）；政治或组织中的正式代表权。

examples.en: The new law increases representation for small regions.
examples.zh: 新法律增加了小地区的代表权。

examples.en: Student representation is important in school decisions.
examples.zh: 在学校决策中，学生代表参与很重要。

definition.en: A statement or claim made to influence decisions, especially in business or law (often used in plural).
definition.zh: 陈述；说明；（尤指商业或法律中为影响决定而作出的）声明（常用复数）。

examples.en: The company made representations about the product’s safety.
examples.zh: 公司就产品的安全性作出了陈述。

examples.en: False representations can lead to legal trouble.
examples.zh: 虚假陈述可能引发法律问题。

extraExplanation: “representations”是名词复数，单数是“representation”。常见搭配：representation of (…的呈现/描绘)，a visual representation（可视化表达），political representation（政治代表权）。
在媒体与文化讨论中，representation 常指对某个群体（如性别、种族、残障等）的“呈现是否公平、真实、多元”。这种用法带有社会议题色彩。

summary.en: A representative is someone who speaks or acts for others, or something that is typical of a group.
summary.zh: Representative 指“代表某团体的人”，也可作形容词表示“有代表性的、典型的”。

definition.en: A person chosen to speak or act for a group, company, or other people.
definition.zh: 代表；（被选出）代表某个团体或他人发言或办事的人。

examples.en: Each class elected a representative to talk with the school principal.
examples.zh: 每个班都选出一名代表去和校长沟通。

examples.en: The sales representative will call you tomorrow.
examples.zh: 销售代表明天会给你打电话。

definition.en: A person who is elected to a government body to make laws or decisions for the public.
definition.zh: （民选）议员；（在政府机构中）代表民众行使权力的人。

examples.en: She is a representative in the state legislature.
examples.zh: 她是州议会的一名议员。

examples.en: Write to your representative if you disagree with the policy.
examples.zh: 如果你不同意这项政策，可以写信给你的议员。

definition.en: Typical of a group; showing the common features of something.
definition.zh: 有代表性的；典型的。

examples.en: These results are representative of the whole population.
examples.zh: 这些结果具有代表性，能反映整体人群。

examples.en: The museum has a representative collection of modern art.
examples.zh: 这家博物馆收藏了一批有代表性的现代艺术作品。

extraExplanation: “representative”来自“represent”（代表、体现）+“-ative”（表示“具有……性质/作用”的形容词后缀）。所以它既可以指“代表某人/某团体的人”（名词），也可以指“能体现整体特征的”（形容词）。
在美国政治语境里，常见用法是“Representative + 姓”（如 Representative Lee），通常指众议员；口语中也常把销售/客服人员叫“rep”（sales rep）。

summary.en: Representative can mean a person who speaks/acts for others, or something that is typical of a group; in business it often means a sales or service agent.
summary.zh: Representative既可指“代表人”，也可指“有代表性的”；在商务语境中常指销售/客服等“代表”。

definition.en: A person chosen or elected to speak or act for other people (for example, a group, company, or country).
definition.zh: 代表；代表人（被选出或被委派来为某个团体、公司或国家发言或办事的人）。

examples.en: Each department sent a representative to the meeting.
examples.zh: 每个部门都派了一名代表去开会。

examples.en: She is a representative of her community on the city council.
examples.zh: 她是市议会中代表她所在社区的代表。

definition.en: Typical of a larger group; showing the main qualities of that group.
definition.zh: 有代表性的；典型的（能体现某一整体的主要特征）。

examples.en: This survey is not representative of the whole population.
examples.zh: 这项调查并不能代表整体人口。

examples.en: The museum has a representative collection of modern art.
examples.zh: 这家博物馆拥有一批有代表性的现代艺术藏品。

definition.en: In business, someone who sells or promotes a company’s products or services (often called a sales representative).
definition.zh: （商业）业务代表；销售代表（负责推广或销售公司产品/服务的人）。

examples.en: A sales representative will contact you within 24 hours.
examples.zh: 销售代表会在24小时内联系您。

extraExplanation: “representative”来自“represent”（代表、体现）+“-ative”（表示“具有……性质/作用”的后缀），所以既可以指“代表的人”（名词），也可以指“具有代表性的”（形容词）。
常见搭配：representative of（……的代表/具有……代表性）；sales representative（销售代表）；customer service representative（客服代表）。
在统计/调查语境里，“representative”很关键：a representative sample 表示“有代表性的样本”，强调样本能反映总体特征。

summary.en: “Representatively” means either (1) in a way that fairly reflects a larger group, or (2) in the role of a representative.
summary.zh: “representatively”表示（1）以具有代表性的方式、能反映整体；或（2）以代表身份、作为代表地。

definition.en: In a way that is typical of a larger group, so it fairly shows what the whole group is like.
definition.zh: 以具有代表性的方式；典型地（能公平地反映整体或多数情况）。

examples.en: The survey includes people from different ages and regions, so the results are representatively balanced.
examples.zh: 这项调查涵盖不同年龄与地区的人，因此结果在代表性上较为均衡。

examples.en: To judge the program fairly, we should choose test users representatively, not just our friends.
examples.zh: 为了公平评估这个项目，我们应以具有代表性的方式选择测试用户，而不是只找朋友。

definition.en: As a representative or spokesperson; in the role of representing someone or something.
definition.zh: 作为代表（或代言人）地；以代表身份。

examples.en: She spoke representatively for the entire team at the meeting.
examples.zh: 她在会议上以团队代表身份发言。

examples.en: The mayor attended representatively, even though other officials handled the details.
examples.zh: 市长以代表身份出席，尽管细节由其他官员处理。

extraExplanation: “representatively”常出现在学术写作或新闻报道中，强调“样本/观点是否能代表整体”（representative sample）。口语里更常说：“in a representative way”或“that really represents …”。
常见搭配：representatively selected（具有代表性地选取）、representatively sampled（抽样具有代表性）、representatively balanced（代表性均衡）。
注意与“respectively（分别地）”区分：两者拼写相近，但意义完全不同。

summary.en: Representativeness means the quality of being typical of a larger group, especially how well a sample reflects the population.
summary.zh: representativeness 指“代表性/典型性”，尤其用于说明样本在多大程度上能反映总体。

definition.en: the quality of being typical of a group, category, or whole; how well something stands for or reflects the larger group
definition.zh: 代表性；典型性：指某事物在多大程度上能代表或反映一个群体、类别或整体

examples.en: Researchers checked the representativeness of the sample before drawing conclusions.
examples.zh: 研究人员在下结论前先检查样本的代表性。

examples.en: The museum wanted a collection that showed the representativeness of local culture.
examples.zh: 博物馆希望藏品能体现本地文化的代表性。

examples.en: One person’s experience doesn’t guarantee representativeness for everyone.
examples.zh: 一个人的经历并不一定能代表所有人。

definition.en: in statistics and research: how closely a sample matches the population it is meant to describe
definition.zh: （统计与研究中）样本代表性：指样本与其所要描述的人群总体在特征上有多相符

examples.en: Low representativeness can lead to biased results.
examples.zh: 代表性不足可能导致有偏的结果。

examples.en: They used random sampling to improve representativeness.
examples.zh: 他们采用随机抽样来提高代表性。

extraExplanation: 构词提示：representativeness = representative（有代表性的）+ -ness（名词后缀，表示“……的性质/状态”）。常见搭配有：sample representativeness（样本代表性）、ensure/improve representativeness（确保/提高代表性）、lack of representativeness（缺乏代表性）。
使用场景：这个词在学术写作、调查研究、市场调研里很常见，强调“能不能以小见大”。日常口语中更常用 typicality（典型性）或 say something is representative（有代表性）。

summary.en: Representativenesses = plural of representativeness: different degrees or instances of how well something represents a larger whole.
summary.zh: representativenesses 是 representativeness（代表性）的复数：指不同程度/不同方面的“能否代表整体”。

definition.en: (Plural) the qualities of being representative; the degree to which one person/thing/sample accurately reflects a larger group or whole.
definition.zh: （复数）代表性；能够代表整体/群体的程度；样本是否能真实反映总体的特性。

examples.en: Researchers tested the representativenesses of the survey samples to make sure the results could be trusted.
examples.zh: 研究人员检验了这些调查样本的代表性，以确保结果可信。

examples.en: Different schools have different representativenesses, so one campus cannot speak for the entire city.
examples.zh: 不同学校的代表性不同，因此一个校区不能代表整座城市。

extraExplanation: “representativenesses”是名词“representativeness”的复数形式，比较少见；在学术写作里更常用“levels/degrees of representativeness”（代表性的程度）或直接用单数“representativeness”来指一种总体特质。
常见搭配：representativeness of the sample（样本的代表性）、improve/ensure representativeness（提高/确保代表性）、lack of representativeness（缺乏代表性）。

summary.en: “Representatives” means people who speak or act for others, especially delegates, elected officials, or company agents.
summary.zh: “representatives”指代表他人或组织发言、行事的人，常见于代表团、民选官员或公司代理/销售与客服人员等语境。

definition.en: People chosen to speak or act for others; delegates or members of an organization (plural of representative).
definition.zh: 被选出来代表他人发言或行事的人；代表、代表委员（representative 的复数）。

examples.en: Representatives from each department met to discuss the new policy.
examples.zh: 各部门的代表开会讨论新政策。

examples.en: The company sent two representatives to the trade show.
examples.zh: 公司派了两名代表去参加贸易展会。

examples.en: Voters expect their representatives to listen and respond.
examples.zh: 选民希望他们的民意代表能倾听并回应。

definition.en: Salespeople or agents who represent a company to customers (common in business: sales representatives, customer service representatives).
definition.zh: 代表公司与客户沟通的销售人员或代理人（商业中常见：销售代表、客服代表等）。

examples.en: Please contact a customer service representative for help with your order.
examples.zh: 如需订单协助，请联系一位客服代表。

examples.en: Our sales representatives visit clients every week.
examples.zh: 我们的销售代表每周都会拜访客户。

extraExplanation: “representatives”通常是名词复数。常见搭配有：elected representatives（民选代表）、government representatives（政府代表）、student representatives（学生代表）、sales representatives（销售代表）、customer service representatives（客服代表）。
在美国语境里，若首字母大写的“Representatives”常指美国众议院议员（Members of the House of Representatives），属于政治/新闻语体。

summary.en: Representativeship means the role or legal status of acting as a representative for someone or a group.
summary.zh: Representativeship 指作为代表的角色或（尤指法律上的）代表/代理资格。

definition.en: the role, status, or function of being a representative (acting or speaking for another person or group)
definition.zh: 代表身份；代表职能（为他人或团体行事或发声的角色/地位）

examples.en: As class president, her representativeship meant listening to students and reporting their concerns to the school.
examples.zh: 作为班长，她的代表职责包括倾听同学并向学校反映大家的诉求。

examples.en: The organization strengthened its representativeship by inviting members from different regions to join the board.
examples.zh: 该组织通过邀请来自不同地区的成员进入理事会来加强其代表性。

definition.en: (law) the legal capacity to act as someone’s representative, especially in managing an estate or legal rights
definition.zh: （法律）代理/代表资格（尤指在遗产管理或权利主张中作为他人代表的法律资格）

examples.en: The court granted him representativeship to administer the deceased person’s estate.
examples.zh: 法院授予他代表资格，以管理逝者的遗产。

examples.en: Without representativeship, she could not sign documents on behalf of the estate.
examples.zh: 没有代表资格，她就不能以遗产的名义签署文件。

extraExplanation: “Representativeship”在日常英语中比较少见，常见于正式或法律语境；日常表达更常用“representation”（代表/代理）或“the role of a representative”（代表的角色）。
词形：representative（代表）+ -ship（表示“身份、状态、职位”的后缀，如 friendship 友谊、leadership 领导力）。

summary.en: Representativity means how well someone/something (especially a sample in research) represents a larger group.
summary.zh: Representativity 指（尤其在研究中）某人/某事物或样本对更大群体的代表程度。

definition.en: the quality of being representative; how well someone or something reflects a larger group or category
definition.zh: 代表性；（某人或某事物）在多大程度上能反映更大群体或类别

examples.en: The committee lacks representativity because it includes very few young people.
examples.zh: 这个委员会缺乏代表性，因为几乎没有年轻人。

examples.en: We improved the representativity of the survey by inviting participants from different regions.
examples.zh: 我们通过邀请来自不同地区的参与者，提高了调查的代表性。

definition.en: (especially in statistics and research) the extent to which a sample accurately reflects the population it is meant to describe
definition.zh: （尤指统计与研究）样本对总体的代表程度；样本能否真实反映总体

examples.en: Researchers tested the representativity of the sample before drawing conclusions.
examples.zh: 研究人员在得出结论之前检验了样本的代表性。

examples.en: Low representativity can lead to biased results.
examples.zh: 代表性不足会导致结果偏差。

extraExplanation: “Representativity”在学术写作中常见，但日常英语里更常用“representation”（代表性/代表情况）或“representativeness”（代表性，尤其是统计学语境）。如果你是在写论文或报告，统计语境下用“representativeness”通常更自然。

summary.en: “Represented” means acted or spoke for someone, or showed/expressed something (often as a symbol or example).
summary.zh: “represented”是 represent 的过去式/过去分词，表示“代表/代言”或“呈现、描绘、象征、体现”。

definition.en: to speak or act for someone or something; to be an official voice for them
definition.zh: 代表；代言；作为……的发言人/代理人

examples.en: The lawyer represented her in court.
examples.zh: 律师在法庭上代表她。

examples.en: Our team representative will contact you soon.
examples.zh: 我们的团队代表很快会联系你。

definition.en: to show, describe, or present something in words, art, numbers, or symbols
definition.zh: 表现；描绘；陈述；用文字/艺术/数据/符号呈现

examples.en: This chart represents sales growth over time.
examples.zh: 这张图表展示了销量随时间的增长。

examples.en: The novel represents life in a small town.
examples.zh: 这部小说描绘了小镇生活。
